"Oh really?" I smirked. "You're going to kill the future king of this kingdom? Wouldn't that make you a traitor?"
I looked over in Amelia's direction and winked at her as she had already gotten flustered because I had repeated such a thing. I hoped she knew that I was only joking, just like she had been doing back then when she had told her people about it.
"The future king is me!"
"Oh… is that so? But Amelia told me she wanted to get rid of you?" I said nonchalantly.
I could already hear the murmurs coming from the crowd. They seemed very confused over what was happening at the moment.
"Actually… aren't you already a traitor? Making deals with one of the sons of the Demon King?" I smirked.
I didn't mind revealing such information to everyone here since I knew that nothing would come out of this place. And I could always remove those memories from their mind.
"I did what was necessary for our survival!" He shouted. "Everyone here should thank me for it."
"Thank you? Don't make me laugh. You gave up on them. Instead of fighting, you surrender yourself to the demons. You didn't even attempt to fight. You're just a pathetic elf who is trying to justify your shitty actions to make you feel better. You didn't make the right choice, and everyone here should hate you. No one here fucking likes you."
I spat at him as I finished saying those words. And it just felt so freaking good.
However, as I did so, I noticed the eyes of the Royal Adviser slowly changing colors, just like what had happened with Derek back then.
"Seems like the demons really found a way to demonize people without it showing whatsoever…" I muttered. "I won't kill you just yet. I'm going to need information as to how you became a demon."
I needed information. I knew that Ava was working on it, but if I could get some information right now about the new method they had to make demons, it would be great since he found a way to identify the hidden demons. Then, the hidden war would be won.

chapters.title: Chapter 157 - 156 - Angry
chapters.content:
When I confirmed that the Royal Adviser was, in fact, a demon, I didn't want to play along with him like I did with Derek because there was little to no point in doing so.
Immediately, I dashed in his direction and took him down without a moment's thought. I didn't want to taunt him. I didn't want to play with him. I just wanted to obtain the information I wanted and get out of here. Within moments, I was now holding onto him, detaining him.
Amelia was shocked by my actions as she just ran in my direction with a frown on her face. She came right beside me and whispered, "Is something wrong? Are you sure that we should do this in front of… all of them?"
I just smiled at her and said, "Yes, I just discovered this man is now a demon. I wouldn't be surprised if most of the nobles were also demons now that have infiltrated your kingdom."
Amelia's eyes widened as she just couldn't believe the words that had just come out of my mouth. It wasn't anything like she had expected. In fact, it was the furthest thing away from it. She thought that the nobles had been colluding and helping Zero, and that was it. But if they had become demons, then this was not something she could even attempt to forgive.
"I-Is that true? Did you really become one?" Amelia immediately asked the royal adviser.
He just smirked. "I just did what I thought was right… we have no chance of winning against them. If only you saw what I saw back then, you would have made the same decision as me… I swear. There is no way we're going to win. The people supporting them are way more powerful than any of us here. Even if this new boyfriend of yours supports you, you're all going to die."
"B-Boyfriend?" She blushed. "What are you talking about! He's not my boyfriend… yet."
She glanced at me while she uttered those words, trying to see my reaction. However, seeing that I didn't have any, she focused once more on the discussion before her.
"Siding with the demons isn't something that anyone should do, no matter what. Tell me, who else entered this deal with you?"
However, this time, the royal adviser stayed silent. It seemed he wasn't planning on revealing such information.
"Do you see all those girls behind me, standing in the cold?" Amelia asked him. "Well, they were all part of his "collection" of slaves. That's the man you were working for. A disgusting being that deserved nothing else but a painful death, and that's exactly what we gave him." Amelia shuddered. "Y-You're so disgusting… why would you even help such a man."
Tears started to form in the corner of her eyes as she continued to speak up. "I-I trusted you… and everyone else. J-Just, why did you have to betray me?"
I could see that Amelia was on the verge of breaking down; she was learning too many shocking things at once, and she just couldn't handle them. After all, she was still young from the looks of it, making her very emotional to most things like this.
"Amelia. I just did what was right for this kingdom. I did this for you. Everything I ever did was for you."
She shook her head. "If it was really for me, then you would have told me. You just did everything in my back, leaving me in the dark."
"Obviously, I did. Look at your reaction right now. That's why I didn't tell you everything. It would have made you panic for no real reason."
"No reason?! Are you absolutely crazy!" Amelia shouted as she slapped him right across the face in front of everyone. Then, she turned toward the rest of the Ice Elves. "All of you go back to your homes!"
Right away, most of the elves listened as they could clearly see that their queen was very angry, and they didn't want to be the ones suffering her wrath. Amelia's beautiful long hair suddenly started floating in the air behind her. Her eyes turned ice cold, and ice appeared in her hands.
"You fucking traitor!" She shouted as she froze his stomach as she saw his face squirming in pain.
I just watched as she did that, thinking that maybe Amelia wasn't that different from Emma right now. She was torturing him in a similar way to what they had done to Zero… and she didn't even need my help to do it.
I didn't say it out loud, but… it was pretty hot seeing her mad.
"Tell me. Who else made a deal with that demon!" She shouted.
"I-I don't know… a lot of us did," he muttered right away, no longer bothering to hide information.
"How did you even become a demon? What did he do to you? What were your plans for our kingdom?"
Amelia's questions kept coming out of her mouth, and I could feel her power getting stronger and stronger as time passed by. Her anger was making it harder for her to control herself, and to be honest, I was quite surprised by the amount of strength coming from her. It was definitely impressive, a lot more than I had judged.
She was way stronger than I had expected. Well, she was the queen of an entire kingdom. She was bound to be powerful.
"Let's go and see who the rest of the traitors are," I finally said, trying to regain control of the situation. After all, there was no point in torturing him in front of everyone. It was better to continue this in private so that Amelia could keep some faces for her subjects.
Amelia agreed quickly, and within a few moments, we were headed for the Ice Castle, where most nobles were hiding, not having the slightest clue of what was happening at the kingdom's gate.
I couldn't wait to see the look of shock on all of their faces when we arrived. It would surely be quite a funny sight.

chapters.title: Chapter 158 - 157 - A Queen's Authority
chapters.content:
We didn't waste any time as we just blazed right through the doors to the castle, opening them as wide as we could and causing a slight glacial breeze to move inside the castle. Right as we entered, there were already nobles arguing with each other about various things. However, their conversation died down as they all looked toward the entrance of the Ice Castle, probably expecting the royal adviser to come back.
But, to their surprise, it wasn't only the royal adviser who came through those doors as both myself and I walked beside him, still holding onto him, making sure that he wouldn't try anything funny.
There were a few nobles currently tied down in the middle of the throne room, and Amelia quickly understood that those were the nobles who hadn't betrayed her. However, there were so few of them that she could only wince. She wasn't graceful for their loyalty… she was simply disgusted at those who betrayed her for all these years, acting like they were on her side.
"I-Is that the queen?" One of them finally muttered as he looked over in our direction.
"The queen? Wasn't she supposed to be dead?"
"I don't know, just look. She's even holding onto someone… is that the royal adviser? She captured the royal adviser!" The elf muttered, losing his mind. "But didn't the royal adviser say that the queen was dead, killed by Zero… just what the hell is happening?"
"The only reason I joined your side was because I thought that the queen was dead!" Another elf chimed in, already trying to break free of this situation as he knew that nothing good would come by being affiliated with the rest of them.
Nevertheless, Amelia didn't even pay attention to what any of them were saying as she had more important things to do at the moment, like showing everyone in this room what happened when they betrayed her.
"Everyone, silence," Amelia said in a very calm, cold tone.
She barely whispered the words; however, they echoed within the entire throne room, sending shivers down everyone's spines.
Then, Amelia simply walked forward in silence as I followed her, holding onto the royal adviser. She walked as everyone in the room's gazes locked onto her. Amelia didn't even give them a single glance as she walked toward her throne once she reached it. She sat on her throne and placed her icy crown on her head.
"Bow down to your queen."
Her words held a lot of meaning for everyone in the room. They knew that if they didn't listen to her every word, they would die instantly. They had never seen this look of hatred on their queen's face. However, everyone knew of her power, and they knew that she hadn't become the queen by pure luck.
None of them could even dream of beating the queen in a fight, even if they all allied together. She was just that powerful.
As a result, everyone got on their knees, their faces facing the ground, not even daring to look up.
"It seems some of you still know who your queen is, or had you forgotten?"
I watched on the sidelines as she continued talking, practically admiring Amelia as I couldn't believe it. She had just taken control of this entire situation with only a few words without the slightest hint of violence. She was truly worthy of being a queen, from her beauty to her power to her authority, and there was no doubt that she was worthy of being a royal.
She was honestly mesmerized by that serious look on that cute face of hers…
'Did I just say cute…?' I thought, embarrassed of the thought, as this was no time to be thinking of such things. However, I just couldn't help it; she was really hot at the moment, and she was gaining some points for sure. This new dominant side of hers was definitely something that I liked, especially since she was docile around me.
It was as if she was a different person when she was alone with me.
Nevertheless, I got out of my reverie as Amelia continued to talk.
"We have found this traitor trying to leave the kingdom the same way practically all of my people did. Can anyone tell me in detail what happened while I was gone? If the answer isn't good enough, you will be punished," Amelia uttered a cold glint in her eyes.
The man from earlier, who was trying to make himself pardoned, instantly opened his mouth like a good little dog listening to her master.
"Once you left, all traitors went to see the Royal Adviser and found him in your closet, unconscious… at that point, everyone was thrown into a state of panic. Coupled that with the fact that you left with the stranger on your left. The city was thrown into a state of panic because once the royal adviser woke, he told everyone within the city about your death, and it only created more chaos."
Amelia just nodded at those words as she had already imagined a similar situation in her mind. This definitely made a lot of sense, and she hadn't expected anything less.
"Now, I want to know what your relation to Zero is?"
However, as Amelia said, I had no choice but to speak up.
"If any of you is found lying about your relation to Zero and what he gave you in exchange for your support, you will die. Keep that in mind."
My words were uttered in a calm voice. However, they knew that I wasn't joking.
The same person spoke up first. "I-I don't know anything about that guy, only what the royal adviser told me. That in the future he would dominate the world and that he killed our queen! And that if I wanted to survive, I needed to join his side of the war."
I confirmed that these words were the truth with the help of my skill. However, that was only one person. There were still over 25 people in the room who still hadn't spoken up.
It was time for a little interrogation.

chapters.title: Chapter 159 - 158 - You're Cute When You're Mad
chapters.content:
Everyone who was still inside the room turned their eyes to me. Some of them remembered me from when I had entered tied up like a prisoner and could only frown when they saw that I was standing next to the queen now as if I was her equal.
"Why is this human even speaking up? He's not even part of our kingdom. I don't care what he says, and I won't listen to a single word coming from him," an elf muttered.
However, Amelia quickly reacted as I could see her clenching her jaw and fists very tightly.
"Anyone who disrespects Caedrel will also be killed on sight. He's more important to me than any of you," Amelia declared as she blushed slightly while looking in my direction.
It had been a few times already that she had declared just how much she valued my presence; earlier, she said that I would become their king; now, she was saying to those nobles that I was more important in her eyes than any of them. Honestly… I wasn't sure what to say. I could only smile and thank her mentally at the moment.
It meant a lot to me that someone would openly declare my worth to everyone around me. Usually, I would just play it off as if it was nothing, but it was different when Amelia was saying it… the resolved look on her face gave it a lot more meaning than anyone else ever said.
The more time I spent with Amelia, the more I realized that I liked her… however, I still couldn't get into a relationship with her or with anyone actually. I had too many secrets hidden from the world, and I knew that I would have to lie to them if I were to get into a relationship. Lying to my loved ones wasn't something that I liked doing, and I never would.
For the time being, I would just have to keep my distance slightly from them… however, I needed to make sure that it didn't seem like I would be pushing them away from me. That would make things even more complicated for me to handle.
Nevertheless, once Amelia said those things to everyone in the throne room, their mouth were shut almost instantly. They also knew that she was dead serious about what she had just said.
"Now, everyone will answer the question I'm about to utter one by one. I need to verify something. Answer by saying either yes or no. I don't want any justifications of any kind."
Everyone quietly nodded, scared to offend me, it seemed. They had stopped being arrogant, which was a nice change of pace.
"Are you a demon?" I uttered my question and pointed it out to the royal adviser. "You answer to it and make an example for everyone to follow."
"Yes," the royal adviser answered as he could barely stay straight on his knees now.
It came out as the truth, confirming that he was indeed a demon and that my strategy would work on anyone else within this room.
Then, I pointed toward another noble and asked the same question. "Are you a demon?"
"Of course not! I would never."
When I looked at him and used my skill, the answer came out as a lie.
However, I haven't reacted yet. I moved onto another traitor and asked the same thing.
He also lied. He was also a demon. I had a feeling that everyone who had betrayed the demons was actually a demon. But I couldn't be sure just yet as I asked yet another person the same question. Again, that person lied; it seemed they thought that I was foolishly hoping for them to tell the truth. However, they couldn't be more wrong. I could discern their lies and the truth. Every time they answered one of my questions, they were doomed.
Everyone who was a demon would die. However, having so many different people who had undergone the process of demonization was certainly something that I was interested in and that I needed to know a lot more about without a doubt in my mind.
However, I had a feeling that no one here would be able to tell me anything about it. Perdere wouldn't be so careless as to do something like this since they knew that those people were at risk of getting discovered. They most likely have security plans regarding those things. Anyway, I had nothing to lose.
I continued to ask everyone the same question, and it turned out that everyone had already become a demon apart from those currently tied up. Oh, and that guy had told Amelia everything he knew about the situation. They were the only ones who were corrupted. However, I still didn't say anything as I went through every one.
Most of them were just looking in my direction, confused, as they didn't understand the purpose of those questions, and the most courageous ones raised their voices once I was done. "What was the purpose of this? Of course, none of us are demons; that would be impossible! We are ice elves. Just look at us!"
A stifled laugh escaped my mouth as I got closer to Amelia and muttered in her ear what I had just discovered. After all, she should be the one taking revenge on them in whatever way she seemed fit. She was the one who would be the most angry about the current situation. Those nobles were people she trusted last week, and everything had changed so drastically now that she had discovered all the atrocities they had committed.
"I trust you, Caedrel. Do what you seem best? I don't care if they die if you torture them. But I only ask you to give me the royal adviser. I want to have a quick conversation with him about what he did to my kingdom."
I smirked. "You're cute when you're angry. Did you know that?"
Amelia instantly blushed as she looked away from my intense gaze and whispered, "Idiot."

chapters.title: Chapter 160 - 159 - You Think You Can Beat Me?
chapters.content:
Amelia had left with the royal adviser, leaving me with the rest of the traitors, who were all glaring at me as if I was nothing more than an ant. While they were all scared of the queen, it seemed they were not aware of my strength, as they didn't respect me whatsoever.
As soon as Amelia had left, every single one of them had started speaking up against me, thinking that there was no chance for me to handle them. However, they couldn't be more wrong about this. At most, all of them were low-level demons that were not powerful whatsoever. Killing them would be even possible with my eyes closed; the only reason why they were still standing and that I hadn't ripped their mouths was because some of them could have some information about Perdere.
"I'm curious. How did every single traitor become a demon? Did you guys infiltrate this place?" I shook my head. "But that would be impossible for all nobles to have infiltrated here. It means that the demons have really managed to find a way to demonize humans, elves, and others without it showing whatsoever."
Once more, they all looked over in my direction with frowns.
"What the hell are you talking about?! We already told you that we aren't demons? Didn't you hear us?" The leader of the traitors spoke up from the looks of it, not backing down in the slightest. "You're the one who needs to answer our questions. How the hell did you convince the queen to support you?"
"Oh, I can answer to that. I didn't do anything. She came to me. That's all." I smirked as I knew that a lot of them would be jealous of me. I had already noticed how some of them had gazes of lust for their queen, hoping that they could touch her, fondle every single part of her body… and they were clearly mad that a human who the queen had barely met had managed to.
"Bullshit! The queen isn't such an easy lady. You must have manipulated her into liking you!"
"Unlike some of you." I started walking down from the throne toward the leader of the traitors. "I have some charisma, and I am not one to betray others because I'm scared of something. I'm not a pathetic little loser like all of you." I pushed my index against his chest. "Unlike you, I'm not someone who sold its soul to gain more power."
'Well… I did, but I didn't mean it in the literal sense of it,' I thought, shaking my head.
"You're lucky that I don't kill every single one of you right now. Actually, that's exactly what will happen if you don't answer some of my questions about Perdere."
As I uttered that word, everyone in the round suddenly turned and stared at me, frowning heavily.
"Where did you hear that word?" The leader, who was now barely an inch away from me, asked.
"Not sure. I think Zero mentioned it when I killed him earlier. Or maybe it was another demon… I'm not too sure. I already killed too many to keep count."
However, I didn't get the scared reaction that I had been expecting as he just started laughing right in my face out of nowhere. "Y-You killed Zero?! As if that's possible for a weak little human like you… Zero could beat you with his eyes closed."
"Are you actually that stupid?" I just couldn't believe what was coming out of their mouths. "Of course, I killed him, dumbass; otherwise, how would I have returned alive from the Icy Lake?"
The leader of the traitors had the words stuck in his throat as he continued to stare at me, wondering what to say. The more I talked about killing Zero, the more they realized that it could be possible.
"Everyone! Let's kill him!" He suddenly shouted as he knew that he was running out of options. He could already see that I wouldn't be letting anyone in this room escape alive.
At the exact same time, demonic energy filled the entirety of the throne room. However, that energy was so much weaker compared to the one of Zero that I knew it wouldn't require me to fight at my full strength whatsoever. I didn't even need to activate a single one of my powers to beat them. My weakened physical body would be enough.
"You really think you can bring me down with that meager energy?" I spat right in their faces. "You're gonna need a lot more than that."
I let my aura run wild inside my body as I let it all out; the demonic energy instantly was subdued and replaced by mine. There were over twenty-five of them, and they still could not even come close to me.
Looks of panic appeared on all their faces as they slowly realized that this would be a lost battle for them.
"E-Everyone, don't be scared! W-We can win!" The man stuttered with every word as he couldn't even look me in the eyes any longer.
"Are you sure about that?" I said as I simply took a single step forward toward him, as I could already see his legs wiggling because of my overwhelming presence. It only became worse and worse as I got closer until he dropped to his knees before he even attempted to attack me.
I walked right before him, and the others could only stare. "Answer me. Do you really think you can beat me?"
"I-I…"
The words were stuck in his throat as he started shaking on his own. I didn't even need to do anything. I only had to show him a glimpse of my strength, and that's all it took to defeat everyone in this room.
"Tell me. Do you know anything about Perdere?" I asked as I looked down.
"I-I don't… I was only contacted by the royal adviser to join them, and once I accepted, he put me to sleep, and once I woke up, I had become a demon. They said… I think they said a demonic seed was inside of me and that if I didn't listen to them, I would die…"
'Demonic seed?' I frowned at those words, but that was certainly valuable information. "That's all. You don't have anything else to tell me?"
He shook his head as fast as he could. "No, I swear that's all I know!"
I smirked. "Perfect."
Then, his head rolled on the ground.

chapters.title: Chapter 161 - 160 - One Last Try
chapters.content:
It took me not even a minute to kill the rest of the Ice Elves' nobles, keeping only those who were tied up. However, instead of going to help them right away, I decided to check on Amelia.
I was worried that she might do something stupid since I had left her alone with the royal adviser. Still, I didn't want her to know that I was spying on her, so I didn't make the slightest noise. As I got closer to her room, I could hear literal shouts coming from there, and they were all coming from Amelia without a doubt.
"Why did you betray me?"
"Why didn't you tell me about those demons?"
"WHY? JUST WHY DIDN'T YOU TELL ME!"
She wanted answers. However, it was clear that the royal adviser wasn't giving her any. In fact, I couldn't hear what he was currently saying because he was practically whispering. I also didn't want to peek inside since there was a chance that Amelia could see me. I knew she wouldn't care, but I wanted this to be her moment, just like she had asked for it to be.
That's why I stayed on the other side of the wall, listening to her words with a lot of caution.
I was interested in what would happen. I wanted to make sure that nothing would happen to Amelia since there was a chance that the royal adviser would transform into a demon and threaten Amelia, which was the last thing that I wanted to happen. If she were to get hurt or, even worse, die, then I would blame myself so much… that's why I needed to be nearby if something went wrong.
"Calm down, Amelia… I never meant to hurt you."
I could only hear him, but that was what was being said on the other side of the door. Was he trying to make her pity him?
I honestly couldn't tell what his plan was. He should know very well that he wouldn't get out of here alive, and he knew that I was nearby. This was his only chance at getting out of here. I knew pretty well that he did not care for Amelia. There was no way he did since he had lied straight to her face for years.
This man was a manipulative and cruel person who would do anything to reach his goals. He had an idea in mind to get out of here.
"Hurt me?" She shouted. "You think what you did just hurt me? It fucking destroyed me…"
I could hear her crying from where I was standing.
"I promise that I'll stop… I'll stop helping the demons. I'll be on your side from now on."
As those words came out of his mouth, I could only hope that Amelia wouldn't accept and wouldn't get manipulated again, just like before. However, she was emotional at the moment. There was a good chance that it would happen no matter what.
I just waited patiently for her answer, hoping she wouldn't get fooled like before.
"Y-You would become my spy against them?" She suddenly uttered… clearly getting manipulated.
"Of course, just untie me, and we can continue to work together. We could rebuild the kingdom as a whole, you and I, against the rest of the world; what do you say?"
"I-I…"
I could only shake my head because of how naive Amelia was. It was a good thing that I was nearby. Otherwise, she might have made a grave mistake. She was too easy to manipulate, and even from the other side of the wall, I could tell that he was lying.
"I don't know… I'll go get Caedrel first. I need him to make this decision…"
However, as she pronounced my name, his fake personality crumbled in an instant.
"Again, with this stupid human… you don't need him, Amelia. You only need me. If you need a lover, then I could be yours; we've known each other since we were kids, and we were best friends for years. I'm much better than him in practically everything. You don't need him. You only need me."
I continued to listen. I wanted to see what Amelia's reaction would be. After all, it would show whether something as stupid as this would actually work. If it did, then I knew that Amelia wasn't someone that I could trust. It was obvious that he was manipulating her with his words, and if she didn't realize it at the moment, then there was something wrong with her. No one could be so naive.
"No. Caedrel isn't going anywhere. He's important to me, and I'm sure he wouldn't mind helping you as a spy. He's powerful. He could certainly be of help."
"Amelia, do you trust me?" The royal adviser suddenly uttered.
"No. I don't trust you, not yet. Not after everything you did to me. If anything, you're lucky that you aren't with Caedrel right now, or else, you would be dead by now. He told me how you betrayed me for all these years, acting like you were on my side. Do you really think a few words and a few promises can make me trust you? Do you really think that I'm so naive?" She shook her head. "Either I go and get Caedrel, or I will get rid of you right now."
"Is that so?" The man uttered, his voice cold and collected. "You no longer need me, is that it?"
"W-What is happening to you?" Amelia suddenly shouted, and I could hear her footsteps getting closer to the door. "What are you even turning into?"
"You would have lived if you had accepted my deal. But you just had to bring that HUMAN INTO THE EQUATION!" The royal adviser's voice roared as it was becoming louder and louder.
He was turning into a demon right before her eyes. I didn't even need to watch to know about it. It was obvious.
I moved and finally opened the door. I felt Amelia falling into my arms as she had been against the door, scared out of her mind. It was probably the first time in her life that she was a demon since Zero still had a human-like appearance. It could be a shock to most, especially since it was someone she knew so well.
"Did I arrive too late?" I said with a smirk as I looked down at Amelia's panicked face.

chapters.title: Chapter 162 - 161 - Close Your Eyes
chapters.content:
As I looked up, I could already see the royal adviser's distorted face. It looked over at me with pure hatred, staring me down as if I was a piece of meat that he could devour anytime he wanted. He was angry, very angry with me. After all, I was the one who had ruined his plan from the very beginning. I was the one who had ruined his life.
"YOU! IT'S ALL BECAUSE OF YOU!" The royal adviser shouted, his face tilting to the side as his appearance continued to change into one of a demon.
His skin became charred, and his eyes turned red as if there was a river of blood within them. He grew stronger by the second as he kept looking at me dead in the eyes.
Surprisingly, he wasn't trying to run away from me as fast as he could, which had been what I had expected. Instead, he stood there shouting at me, antagonizing me while I slowly patted Amelia's hair to comfort her.
Even while she was in my arms, I could feel her weak and frail body shaking slightly because of the fear that was slowly consuming her body.
I gave a tight hug and whispered, "Don't worry, I'll take off this. Just close your eyes. I'll tell you to open them again."
She looked at me in the eyes, literal tears forming in the corner of her eyes. She didn't even say anything; she just looked into my eyes with a weak smile that she struggled to even maintain. Then, she slowly closed her eyes and whispered, "I trust you…"
After closing her eyes, I carefully placed her beside me as I looked in front of me once more toward the ugly demon that the royal adviser had become. I only had one goal in my mind, a very simple one at that, to kill him as painfully as I could for all the pain that he gave Amelia. That's all a demon deserved to be killed painfully, especially when he had hurt someone close to me.
It had only been a few days, but Amelia was now one of the people who knew me best. I hadn't opened up to her just yet, but I still trusted her deep down, and to see her crying because of a pitiful demon wasn't something that I would let happen ever again.
"Hm… you really think a human can fight with a demon?" He laughed right in my face. "You think you can beat me?"
However, I didn't bother to say anything. I was tired of talking. I wanted to fight… I had given this man way too many chances already, and I should have killed him before leaving for the Icy Lake. It would have made things much simpler for Amelia once we got back.
Instead of talking, I slowly started walking forward as I activated [Bloodlust], my eyes turning red just like a demon, and I could feel energy running through each of my muscles.
"That much should be enough for a weak demon like you."
I then exuded my aura inside the room, making sure that Amelia wouldn't be affected by it, and took another step forward as I could see the overconfident expression of the demon slowly leaving his face. He was slowly realizing what was happening. He was slowly realizing that he was no match for someone like me.
His transformation as a demon had made him overconfident in his own abilities. But he still had his instincts, and once I revealed just a tiny amount of my power, he realized that he had no chance of winning. He realized that I was a much stronger being than he was.
"Do you realize now how stupid it was for you to become a demon?" I said with a sigh. "If you really wanted to, you could have become much stronger while being an ice elf. You simply chose the easy way out, thinking that there were no other choices."
"Y-You don't know anything!" He shouted. "I had no choice but to make this choice."
"No," I said with conviction, not interested in hearing the excuses of a man who sold his principles for some power. I was already disgusted enough. "You always have a choice, even if one might seem easier than the other."
I was a fervent believer in this. There are always two choices for someone to take, no matter what. That is simply how things are, and nothing will ever change it.
"It was either becoming a demon or dying… you would have made the same choice as me!" He continued to shout, and I could see his legs starting to weaken, just like what had happened with the rest of them in the throne room. It seemed demons really weren't all that confident in themselves.
"I would rather die than become a demon. So, no. I would have never made the same choice as you, never in a million years." I shook my head. "Look at you, I only walked in your direction, and you are already on your knees, scared shitless of me. If I asked you to become my slave to survive, you would probably accept. That's how fucking pitiful you are."
"I-I just don't want to die! P-Please, I'll do absolutely anything… anything you want, I swear."
"I have no need for a demon. All they deserve is one thing and one thing only. Do you know what that is?" I asked, the smile on my face becoming more and more twisted.
"Please… don't kill me… I'll do anything, anything you want."
Seeing him beg was honestly satisfying, and it was a good thing that Amelia still had her eyes closed. thinking of her, I realized that it might make her sadder if I were to torture the royal adviser. After all, even if he had betrayed her, he was still someone important in her eyes.
That's why I decided to be nicer to this demon this time around. I would only cut off his head in one clean strike.
"Goodbye, may we never meet again."
*Thud*
His head dropped onto the ground, and he was now dead.

chapters.title: Chapter 163 - 162 - Just Tell Me
chapters.content:
I walked over to Amelia, who still had her eyes tightly shut, holding onto her legs and forming a small ball. Usually, I wasn't good when it deducted what people were feeling; however, looking at her right now reminded me of myself. Or, at the very least, it reminded me of my past self when I had fought against the first demon I had seen.
I could understand what she was going through. She was scared, maybe even traumatized, that something so evil could exist in this world. She had seen Zero, but he was special; he couldn't actually be considered a demon, and considering that the person who became one was so close to her, he must have made things difficult… even that part was similar to my own situation.
I didn't have the right words for her, and no one could have them since she would have to be the one to fight through all this pain… by her own means. Still, I would do my best so that she doesn't lose herself like I did back then. That was the best I could do for her.
I didn't tell her to open her eyes just yet as I didn't think that seeing the dead body of a "friend" would be something that she would want. Instead, I patted her head slowly and grabbed her in my arms.
"It's not your fault, just know that, alright?" I said as those words hit deep within me. I remember blaming myself for weeks for everything that had happened to those around me who had suffered because of my decisions. "It's his fault that he didn't believe in you…"
She continued to cry with her eyes closed as I left her bedroom, leaving behind yet another dead body. Today had been quite the day, I had killed over 30 demons in such a short time, and I couldn't even begin to imagine the number of demons that had infiltrated the humans, elves, and dwarves… the numbers have to be absolutely crazy. After all, the only thing they need is one mentally weak, and he will accept right away such a thing to happen.
Within a few minutes, I reached the throne room, where I could still see the dead bodies of all the nobles that I had killed, where a few remaining nobles who hadn't betrayed Amelia were still there.
I could already see them asking for help, but with a snap of my fingers, I removed their right to speak. Amelia was unstable right now. I didn't want her to hear such things. I made them silent and quickly helped them untie while still holding onto Amelia, who now had her arms wrapped around my neck.
"Can I open my eyes now?" She whispered… her voice absolutely broken.
"Not yet, don't worry, I'll tell you."
It took a few more minutes, but I got out of the Ice Castle and finally told her that she could open her eyes.
"You can open your eyes now…"
Her eyes finally fluttered as tears kept running down her face… no matter how much she tried, she couldn't keep those tears for herself. They kept going and going as she continued to look at my face from up close, so close that I could feel her hot and warm breath against my face.
She kept looking at me in the eyes and then toward my lips, over and over again.
"A-Are you sure that you don't like me?" She finally uttered. "Because the more I know about you… the more he makes me like you."
I didn't say anything just yet. I tried, but I didn't know what to say. However, as she continued to glare at me, I had no choice but to say something… even if it wasn't what she wanted to hear.
"You don't know me… no one really knows about me. I like you, but I don't want to hide things from you about my life, about my past… about everything I do. I… just can't."
Amelia frowned right away. "Then just tell me… I won't say anything to anyone, please. I-I just don't want to lose you to someone else. It'll only hurt me even more."
"I…" I didn't know what to tell her. I wasn't ready to tell her everything… I wanted to try, but I couldn't. I wished my life was a simple one, but it just isn't. M-My life is complicated, too complicated for anyone to enter it. "I can't."
I knew that pushing people away was the best thing I could do… that's always what I did, and it never failed me yet. I knew that it made me lonely and made it harder for people to approach me.
"Why… why can't you tell me? I just want to know you. I don't care about being a queen any longer; everyone I knew betrayed me, and I'm all alone. If I can't know you, then I don't know what I'll do…"
She kept crying, which was just making things harder for me. I was never affected by emotions, but right now… looking at her, it was hard to resist. Maybe it was because I truly cared about her, but I felt bad for her. I wanted her to be happy, but I didn't know how to give her that happiness.
"I'll always be there for you, don't worry."
I continued to hug her.
"I don't want to hurt you. I just can't be with you right now… I can't be with anyone. Not until this war against the demons finally ends."
She sighed. I could even feel her shaking her head. "Why do you even care about the existence of demons that much… let's just live peacefully away from everything. Wouldn't that be perfect?"
"I'm not one to hide while the rest of the world is slowly getting destroyed by demons. I won't stop until every single one of them is dead, even the demon king."
"But why… just tell me what the demons did for you to hate them so much?" She faintly smiled. "Just tell me, and I won't ask ever again."

chapters.title: Chapter 164 - 163 - A Tender Kiss
chapters.content:
Memories surged. However, I couldn't tell her why I hated demons. I had promised someone very important to me that I would never reveal such a thing, ever. That was my decision, and I was going to respect it until the very end. That person might be dead now, after all those years, but I still respected him…
"I can't tell you, Amelia. Not right now, not ever…" I said as I knew that she would already be fuming by what I said. However, I simply couldn't tell her about what happened in my past and that I hated demons that much. "All I can say is that I lost people very important to me because of them and that I will stop at nothing before they are all dead. It doesn't matter who they are. I will kill them. If you were to become a demon tomorrow, I wouldn't even hesitate to cut off your throat."
Amelia gulped as she looked at me, knowing extremely well that I was serious. "Who did you lose… just tell me, I'm here for you."
"Too many people. I lost my parents for one."
I mentioned the part about my parents because I didn't actually care about them since I had only known them for less than a year after I had transmigrated. The people who had died and caused this hatred would make me emotional, which wasn't something that I wanted to show to others.
I wanted to keep it in for myself. That wall that I had built up for myself wasn't something that would be going away anytime soon.
Amelia didn't say anything just yet as she just hugged me even tighter into her arms, her body squeezing against mine. She was squeezing so hard that I could feel her body, her ample chest against my body. It was as if we were one.
It had an effect on me… but I did my best to hide it.
"I'm sorry for your parents, I didn't know."
'If only you knew about everything…' I shook my head. "It's fine, don't worry about it."
Then, she looked into my eyes again and whispered. "I don't care if you hide things from me… just tell me when you're ready. I won't even ask questions about your past and the demons. What do you say?"
She looked down towards my lips and then at my eyes while beating her own lips.
It was just so sexy… she was seducing me even if I had told myself that I wouldn't get with anyone before the end of this war. However, she was making me regret having such a discussion, and what she said just made it even worse for me to resist her and her beautiful body.
"Let's keep it a secret from others, alright?"
I tried to open my mouth and say something, but she just put her finger on my mouth, telling me to stay quiet.
Her eyes closed, and her head moved forward. She removed her finger from my mouth and pouted her lips.
She was going in for a kiss! And because we were so close, it was impossible for me to dodge it… I had no choice but to accept it, a kiss from the queen of the ice elves, I just knew a ton of guys would be jealous of me, and here I was trying to think of a way to get out of this situation.
But there was no way out. Kissing her was the only option, and if I were to be honest with my body… I also wanted to kiss her very badly. I liked her even if I didn't want to admit it. I was just trying to control myself since I knew that my past and my lies could hurt her in the long run.
Suddenly, I felt her lips pressed against mine, and my eyes just widened. It took a few seconds, but I closed my eyes and kissed her back, placing my hand on the back of her head and bringing her closer to me.
I couldn't see her expression, but I felt her shock when I kissed her. She brought her head back slightly and jumped from surprise in my arms.
However, she quickly calmed down, and we continued to kiss one another for maybe another minute… maybe two, I couldn't tell. Time was passing by slowly but also fast at the same time; I couldn't keep track of it.
All I knew was that when I opened my eyes again, Amelia's face was bright red, and she looking at me lovingly… I was doing the exact same thing, smiling at her lovingly. That kiss was something else. For the first time in my life, I had gotten so close to a girl that I actually liked. However, there was one thing that was making me worried, the fact that my enemies now had a way to attack me indirectly… by attacking Amelia.
I would need to make sure nothing would happen to her if I were to go out with her.
"W- What do you think?" She smirked, still blushing. "How about you keep your secrets, and we continue to kiss each other from time to time… doesn't seem too bad, right?"
I giggled a little. "I guess that it wouldn't be too bad, but we should kiss again so that I can make sure that this is the right decision."
"Sure~!" She smiled brightly because I had finally agreed to go out with her. We kissed again, and this time, it was an even longer kiss as I felt my hands move on her, their own all around her body… then they seemed to have found their war on her ass as I grabbed it and fondled it while we kissed, her eyes widening once again.
"Is it the right decision? What do you think?" Amelia asked as we stopped kissing for a moment.
"I think so…"
I smiled at her as my mind went toward Ava, who was still back in the human kingdom.
"Actually, I was thinking…" Amelia suddenly said as I finally accepted us going out. "Maybe I should come with you to the Human Kingdom… there might be some vixens after you."
"Already jealous, huh?" I smiled as I pinched her red cheeks. "I wouldn't mind if you came, but what would happen to your kingdom?"
"I'll name a new king or queen amongst the nobles remaining… and I'll leave you. Everyone I knew and cared for has either betrayed me or died… I don't want to stay here any longer. I prefer to be around you."

chapters.title: Chapter 165 - 164 - I Need To Tell Father
chapters.content:
One day later,
Amelia had taken care of everything for the Ice Elf Kingdom by appointing a new king on the throne. She knew very well that she was basically abandoning her people by doing so. However, she preferred to leave with me because of all the past events that had happened to her.
"Ready to go?" I asked as we were already at the gates.
She hadn't even told her people that she would be leaving for good. However, I thought that was a good decision since it would only cause more confusion and panic within the Ice Elf Kingdom. There was already the fact I had massacred most of them inside the throne room, which was bound to cause panic if the new king were to announce it to his subjects. If they knew that the queen was leaving them behind, then it would create even more confusion, which was the last thing anyone wanted.
"Yep, let's go!" She said with a bright smile as we walked toward the gate hand in hand.
The same guard that Amelia had "flirted" with when we had left for the Icy Lake was still there and instantly recognized the two of us. However, his eyes were fixated on the queen, which, for some reason, made me somewhat angry as I got in front of her and hid her behind my body.
I didn't want a man to look lustfully at my girlfriend. Was I being possessive? Maybe. However, from the giggle coming from Amelia, it seemed she liked me acting this way. After all, it showed I cared for her and that I wanted people to know that she was mine and only mine.
"Hm, leaving again already?" The guard asked the two of us as he sighed since he couldn't see Amelia's beauty any longer.
"Yeah, we're leaving. We fixed everything that needed fixing."
"Hm, where are you two heading?" He asked.
"None of your business."
Then, he just let us through. After all, I was with the "queen," and he had no right to ask us questions about anything. He just needed to bow down and let us through. As we walked through the gate, I spotted Phoebe, who was waiting for us with all the former slaves, staring at us with a lot of curiosity since we were holding hands, which was something only lovers would do.
The gaze coming from Emma was definitely the most intense one out of all of them.
Still, I didn't mind it. I knew that was how she was and that if she even tried something on Amelia, she would be the one in danger. After all, Amelia wasn't weak. She was just weak in my eyes… to normal people, she was one of the most powerful beings ever.
But to me, she was just my harmless little girlfriend.
"Is everyone ready to head for the tribe?" I asked with a bright smile.
Phoebe, who also noticed how close both Amelia and I were, had a slight frown on her face. Still, she didn't say anything, nor did she ask questions.
"Yeah, let's go. I can't wait to get back home!" She exclaimed excitedly.
As I mentioned the tribe, I still remember one thing Zale told me when I first arrived. I would be able to break the curse that restricts them from going to the outside world. However, even now, I had no idea where that curse was or how I would even begin to break it. I didn't know if he was hoping for something from me once I came back. But I was just as lost as the beginning. I certainly wouldn't be able to help him.
***
POV Laura
I wasn't sure what was happening, but my brother's familiar was standing before me with a look of panic.
It had come through the elven territory without alarming anyone; however, even then, that was a risky move that could have blown my cover for all of the elves. If it's familiar, I had decided to take such a choice; it meant something important had happened to my little brother.
It was a good thing that I was in my room and there was no one else with me right now. Otherwise, I would have no choice but to silence those who had seen this weird little creature that could run faster than the speed of light.
"Tell me. What happened to my brother that you had to come all the way here?" I asked, seeing the creature losing its mind.
"Caedrel found him," the creature uttered, fearing for his life.
"Caedrel…?" I frowned as that name didn't tell me anything right away. However, within five seconds, I knew extremely well what the creature was talking about. Caedrel is the man who caused them problems since the very beginning of the war. "I see. What happened to my brother? He must have lived, but where did he flee?"
The creature shook his head rapidly.
"No? What do you mean? My brother didn't lose?"
The creature shook his head again.
"Then what is it? SPEAK."
I raised my voice out of anger since there was a chance that some elves would come barging inside this room. However, it seemed no one would be doing so. I was still safe from killing anyone for the time being. Even if I wouldn't mind doing so because of how angry I was at the moment.
"He was killed by Caedrel and a friend of his… I don't know of his identity, however."
"He was killed?!" I felt the rage bubbling inside of me. "Someone dared kill my little brother? But how did he even manage such a thing? Caedrel shouldn't have access to Aether. That's the only thing that can truly hurt us."
"He seemed to have gained the ability to manipulate Aether. However, from the skills he showed in his battle, he doesn't know how to use it well just yet."
I couldn't believe it. "A human can use aether?"
This meant that a lot of things could go wrong, especially considering the person who had acquired Aether. He could actually cause us problems now.
"I need to tell Father, and don't worry, we will take our revenge. No one can kill a member of our family and stay alive for very long."

chapters.title: Chapter 166 - 165 - One Week of Break for Lovers
chapters.content:
A week passed,
We had passed by the ancient tribe, where Zale talked to me for a few minutes. I wasn't planning too much time there since Amelia couldn't see the tribe; it was hidden for her. Nevertheless, I gave them Zero's blood, and they made the potion in record time.
They didn't specify the effect of the potion, but they said to give it to someone I loved. That was the only indication they had said.
I knew that it had originally been to save Phoebe, so I could only imagine that it was some kind of health potion that was ridiculously overpowered compared to the rest of the potions I had faced in my life.
In fact, I knew that it was superior to all the potions I had seen before because of the aura surrounding this potion. Still, I would go to one of the many Alchemist shops once I got back to analyze it. After all, as far as I could tell, no one could tell where it came from. They would only know that it was extremely special.
'Wait… I could just show Ava. Still, it might be weird with Amelia around,' I thought in the back of my mind as I glanced to my left at the smiling Amelia, who honestly seemed the happiest since I had met her.
A huge weight was gone from her shoulders, and now she could enjoy life as much as she wanted without anyone ever getting in her way. I was a little bit jealous of her, but I didn't act like it. There was no point in doing so; it was better to keep things hidden from her for the time being and to carry that weight on my shoulder for a little while longer.
Still, I had decided not to head back to the capital right away, spending some time alone with Amelia. Well, she had been the one insisting that we spent some time "off," as she called it.
As for the former slaves, Phoebe was in charge of bringing them back to the human kingdom and explaining a little about what had happened to the king. I also told her to call me if anything went wrong. Still, I didn't think anything would go badly. The king probably knew that I and I had managed to kill the son of a Demon King, and he must be pretty happy right now.
Nonetheless, it was hard to think of all those things since my girlfriend, yes, my girlfriend, was currently sitting on top of me while I was lying.
She was like a fox, pinning me down on the soft mattress, not letting me move a single inch.
"I'm going to eat you up…" She licked her lips as she bent forward and started kissing me again.
That was what our "time off" consisted of. Us getting very intimate with one another. It also led me to discover some things about Amelia, such as the fact that she was extremely possessive of me. She was always kind of addicted to my touch now for some reason as she always stayed right next to me as if she was my pet… though I had to admit that it wasn't something that I disliked.
It's just that sometimes it could get a bit much. I honestly couldn't imagine what would happen when I would go on a mission or leave a place alone. She would completely panic. There was not a doubt about that in the back of my mind.
Still, I liked having her around. It was nice, and it was a needed change of pace in my life. These past few days have honestly been amazing from start to finish, and I loved every moment.
Nonetheless, all good things needed to come to an end. Today was the day that I needed to go back to the human kingdom. After all, my students were waiting for me, amongst other things.
That's why I slowly pushed Amelia off from me. "Amelia, not this morning. You remember, right? I need to go back to the empire."
She clicked her tongue in dissatisfaction. "Tsk, why can't we just stay here… isn't this nice, pretty much the perfect life. You have a cute elf that loves you to death, and we have enough money to sustain ourselves, and we're strong enough that no one will even come near us… We could stay like this until the end of our lives. What do you think?"
I shook my head. "I told you already what I think of this. I'm going back. You can either follow me or stay here. Your choice."
Obviously, I knew the choice she would make. Still, it was pretty funny to see her flushed face as I told her that I might as well leave her behind. Instantly, she clung to me, not letting me go no matter what.
"You're such a meanie!" She exclaimed with a cute pout. "Of course, I'm coming with you, idiot!"
Then, she got up and got her things right away, getting ready to leave.
In fact, she managed to get ready before even me. It seemed like she really didn't want to be left behind.
"Alright, let's go."
Amelia instantly jumped into my arms, and I flew downwards from the mountain where we had spent the past week or so. It was time to head back to the human kingdom and see what had changed while I was gone.
One thing was sure, I had a lot of things to do. More importantly, a lot of people were beaten up because of the actions they took.
Yes, I'm talking about you… the Evergreen family. You're done as soon as I'm done with the Emperor. No one will even want to utter your name once I'm done with y'all.
Taking a video of me and spreading it for everyone to see.
It was a good thing that the Emperor was around; otherwise, things would have been complicated for me. My identity and my strength would have been revealed for everyone to see.

chapters.title: Chapter 167 - 166 - Seeing the Empress Again
chapters.content:
It took one hour or so before both Amelia and I landed in the human kingdom. Obviously, I got down from the ground before anyone could see me since I didn't want rumors of me flying around spreading around the world, especially since flying was such a rare skill that only a few individuals could even grasp.
However, once we reached the gates to the city, things got a bit more complicated since it seemed the guards had received some orders from the Emperor. As soon as they saw me, they immediately dashed in my direction, asking me to follow them; otherwise, they would have no choice but to capture me by force.
I knew there was no chance for them to even capture me. Nevertheless, I decided to follow since I needed to have a discussion with the Emperor, especially considering the message I had left Alexandra before leaving.
There was a good chance that she had changed some words when she had said to the Emperor. After all, I understood that much from our small phone calls with one another.
"I'm curious. Do any of you know why the Emperor asked to see me?"
"We're simply following orders. That's all."
I nodded as I looked over to Amelia, who had kicked a few guards to stay with me. They had tried their best to only bring me to the Emperor. However, they hadn't managed to, as they needed to face Amelia's wrath, which was accentuated when it came to me.
"Gotcha, so you're all pretty much useless, huh?" I muttered as I saw the expressions on each of their faces change.
"Tsk, shut up. You left the human kingdom without telling anyone because you wanted to. If there's anyone who's useless, it's you. You weren't a high-ranking officer, and you're nothing more than a commoner. Don't you dare talk to us as if you're superior?"
First off, everything that he had just said was clearly wrong without a doubt in my mind.
I was not a commoner. I just didn't go around brandishing the fact that I was one, and honestly, I couldn't care less that I was a noble. I stopped being one the moment my parents died, and I abandoned our estate.
As for not being a high-ranking officer in the war, I couldn't tell him off. Though, the only reason I wasn't one was because of my own decisions. It had nothing to do with my skills.
And yes, I had left on my own because the director of the Royal Academy is a fucking dumbass. She's one of the stupidest people I have ever seen in my life. Following me around all the way to the hidden tribe, trying to see me for some stupid reason.
Just thinking about it was making me mad.
"If I'm useless, then just try to fight me. You won't even be able to even lay a single finger on me. I'm faster, stronger, more agile, and I have access to a lot more skills than you all combined. If you were to try to fight me, the only thing that would happen would be your defeat." I looked down at them with a smirk. "Now, stay quiet and guide me to the Emperor's home, pathetic little soldiers."
They all glared their teeth at me. However, they still didn't do anything against me. Maybe because they knew they had no chance against me, or maybe because the Emperor had warned them. Anyway, Amelia seemed to like the fact that they were no longer speaking against me.
It took a few more minutes for us to reach the Empire's manor as on the way, we kept getting interrupted and looks from everyone around. Most people thought that I was a criminal who needed judging, but a few recognized me as a professor.
I didn't know, but it seemed I had obtained some fans here and there in my long absence from this kingdom.
Nevertheless, Amelia and I got through the gate to the Emperor's manor just fine, as we were still being guided by guards. However, on the way there, I spotted the Empress, someone who had some history with me, considering that I had run into her the last time I had seen her at the banquet and dropped onto her body.
I still vividly remember how awkward things had been back then. Still, I couldn't help but admit that she was most likely the most beautiful woman I had seen in my life. The Emperor certainly had made a good choice when choosing his wife.
-Tap!
"Argh… why did you hit me?"
"Tsk, stop ogling her like some pervert! I'm right here, you know!" Amelia shouted, annoyed by the fact that I stared at the Empress.
Nevertheless, the Empress quickly let the guards go and guided us personally.
"It's nice to see you again. The Emperor talked about you a lot while you were gone for over three months."
"Nice to see you again," I replied politely.
"Who's this beautiful woman next to you? An Elf? But why is the color of her hair so white… as if it was made of snow."
My eyes widened. "Ah, she's Amelia. She's the Queen of the Ice Elves; that's why the color of her hair and eyes was like that."
"T-The Queen of Ice Elves?!" The Empress panicked right away, not knowing what to do. "I-I'm sorry, I didn't know that someone as important as you was coming to our manor. If so, I would have made the necessary preparations."
"Ah… no worries, I'm only here to accompany Caedrel. And I'm not really the Queen of the Ice Elves anymore. I gave up on that title to become Caedrel's lover and follow him everywhere in the world!"
The more the Empress heard Amelia talk, the more confused she was becoming. She had literally no idea what was happening.
"The Queen of the Ice Elves and Caedrel Stuart are going out… together?! Really?" She screamed. "Hubby! Come out, this is big news!"

chapters.title: Chapter 168 - 167 - A Interesting Discussion
chapters.content:
The Emperor quickly came out, practically panicked because of the Empress and what she had just shouted.
"Did something happen?" He came out, out of breath, and his eyes widened when he saw who she was talking to.
"Caedrel? You're finally back from the Snowy Mountains?"
The Emperor was having a hard time believing that it really was me from the looks of it. Maybe he had expected that it would take me even more time to get back for some reason. He also looked somewhat scared of me as he kept staring in my direction.
But then his eyes shifted to the person standing next to me, and his eyes widened even more. If it continued like this, he might have a heart attack. He was that shocked.
"T-the Queen of the Ice Elves is here with you…?!" He couldn't believe it. "Just what the hell happened in the Snowy Mountains for her to accompany you all the way here."
Before I could even attempt to reply, the Empress replied in my stead right away without the slightest hesitation.
"They're together! Isn't this amazing?"
The Emperor didn't say anything as his mouth just dropped, staring at both me and Amelia over and over again.
"You…" He pointed in my direction. "…and her? This isn't a prank, right?"
Amelia smiled as she kissed me on the cheek. "Nope! Totally serious! We even took a week together before coming back here… but he insisted on coming back here."
The Emperor has a lot of things that have surely clicked in his mind. After all, my students had returned to the Human Capital before me. That's why he must have wondered where I had left, but now he knew, and it was the last thing that he had expected from me from the looks of it.
"I see, so you two are now together…" The Emperor still couldn't believe it. "Anyway, enough about that, Caedrel, come with me." He looked at Amelia. "As for you, please spend some time with my wife in the meantime; I'm sure there are a lot of things that you could think about."
Amelia had this annoyed look on her face but still nodded. After all, I wasn't leaving with another woman, but the Emperor of the Human Race. There was no danger of me getting stolen.
As we walked toward the Emperor's office, he sure had a lot to say, or rather, ask me about what I had done in my absence, especially about Amelia and our relationship.
"Can I know exactly how the Queen of the Ice Elves is now your girlfriend?"
He really looked annoyed by that fact. I could see it in his eyes… maybe because before, I was always alone and had practically no connections. But that fact had now changed since I was now closely related to the ice elves, which finally gave me a group to support me in my decisions.
"It just came to be. She was really pushy, and I just accepted going out with her. That's all."
"Pushy? Do you mean that she's the one who wants to be with you? Not the other way around?" The Emperor frowned. "That makes no sense, though. I heard rumors as to how she despised men…"
I laughed at him. "Didn't I tell you already? I'm different from normal men. That's probably why she fell for me."
The Emperor just gulped as he nodded before opening the door to his office.
"You can take a seat."
The tone of his voice turned serious right away. The casualness that I had seen beforehand was nowhere to be seen now.
"First, I want to talk about the threats you made to Alexandra. Were you serious about what you said back then?"
"Yes, I was serious about everything I said. I won't be your spy anymore, and my actions against the demons will be solely mine. The reason I made this decision was actually because of Alexandra."
The Emperor frowned slightly at those words.
"What about us becoming enemies…? Were you serious about that, too?"
"Enemies? What are you talking about?"
I frowned at those words. They were certainly not what I had said. I did mention that if he got in my way, then he would have to be careful around me. But he still hadn't done anything of that sort. So, he had no need to be scared of me. Well, even then, he seemed confident that I wouldn't try anything stupid since he had brought me all the way here, completely alone.
I could feel the presence of a few hidden assassins around, but they weren't really threats to me, and the Emperor knew that very well.
"I never said that we would become enemies. That will only be the case if you get in my way. If you don't, then we can keep a friendly relationship without any problems."
"That's not what Alexandra told me, though. She told me you were declaring war against me."
This time, I was the one who closed my eyes and took a deep breath. I needed to stay calm, especially in front of the Emperor. However, one thing was certain: Alexandra would suffer the consequences of her actions.
I took a deep breath before opening my eyes again. "Is that so? I declared war on you? Then why didn't you prepare a "welcome" party for me?"
"I had a feeling that even you weren't stupid enough to do such a thing. And then there was the call with you that reinforced that theory. I thought there was no way you would be my enemy, knowing that I have a video of you showing off your powers. After all, this is the last thing that you would want to spread, right?"
"Are you threatening me?" I looked at him dead in the eyes, losing all my playfulness. "Is that really your plan?"
"Haha!"
"Is that really your plan? Do you think I'm scared of the pitiful assassins hidden? They couldn't even make a dent in my body, even if they gave their all. Now, give me that video. I will be the one taking care of it from now on."
The Emperor didn't respond to my threat, and he also felt the energy being released from my body. However, he managed to keep a straight face through it.
"Actually, I was thinking of keeping it. You know, if you ever wanted to become my enemy."
I didn't say anything as I suddenly stood up, and as I did, I had swords pointed at my throat in all directions. His assassins had decided to play with me from the looks of it.
However, the only reaction they got out of me was a simple smirk.

chapters.title: Chapter 169 - 168 - Magical Contract
chapters.content:
"Did you mishear what I just said?" I asked as I smirked toward the Emperor with swords all around my neck. "You must know that those pathetic assassins can't deal with me, right?"
The Emperor stayed silent as he hadn't thought that the conversation would have headed in such a way.
"I know…still, I can't give you that video. However, I promise to never release it as long as you don't go against humanity."
"I don't trust your words."
Did he think that I was so stupid as to accept such words that held no meaning to me?
He truly thought of me as a complete fool, but new flash, I wasn't a fool.
"That's why I have a magical contract for both you and me to sign."
The Emperor pulled out a piece of paper on which a bunch of things were written that I couldn't read from where I was standing.
"Give that to me."
I placed my hand forward, waiting for him to give me that contract. After all, if it really was just like he had said. Then, I didn't mind signing it since I would never betray humanity anyway. However, I didn't want to sign some kind of trap contract.
I started reading it, and after a few minutes, I was done with it, and the Emperor had not lied. It was truly like he had said. If I turned my back on humanity, then he would be able to reveal the video for everyone to see. But even if I did, at that point, it would be too late to do anything else.
"Alright, I accept. I'll sign that contract of yours. But tell your slaves to back off."
"Leave us alone."
Then they tried to hide again, thinking that I couldn't feel their presence.
"He said to leave. Not to hide again like some cockroaches. If you don't leave, then I will every single one of you."
However, even as I said, they still haven't moved. They weren't listening to my words. That's why I looked over to the Emperor with a knowing smile.
He knew that I wasn't joking. That was exactly what I would be doing if they didn't leave in the next five seconds.
"5…4…3…"
"All of you leave."
Right as he uttered those words, they disappeared from the room, leaving only the two of us and that contract. I didn't waste any time and signed it right away.
"There you go. Happy?"
"Very."
Then, the Emperor sat back down again, and we talked about everything that had happened in the Snowy Mountains. I hadn't talked about everything in detail since I wanted to keep information for myself. But what we mainly talked about was Zero and the fact that there were other beings like him that were just as strong as him out there.
"Any clues on where they might be?" The Emperor asked, very interested in what I had just revealed. I could see from the look on his face that this was new information.
I hadn't mentioned that Zero was the son of the Demon King since I thought that it might make the Emperor panic. As much as he didn't want me to betray humanity, I wanted the same from him. I didn't know his real character, and there was a chance that he would break if he was intimate enough.
"He told me that there were some everywhere. There should be at least someone who is strength in each of the kingdoms. Humans, Elves, Dwarves, everywhere. They are probably fairly high-ranked in all of those places."
Those were just assumptions that I had. But I was 99% sure that they were accurate. They were so strong that there was no doubt that they had reached the higher society in each of those places.
"Even here? Are you sure?" The Emperor didn't think that they had managed to become high-ranking officers in his own kingdom.
"Without a doubt. Someone has infiltrated this kingdom, and he's extremely strong without a doubt."
The Emperor stopped talking for a moment as he was most likely thinking of who it could be.
"Could you help me figure out who that person is?" He suddenly asked after a few moments. He didn't have a clear answer in his mind for sure.
"I could, and I will. But I have some things to do beforehand."
The Emperor wasn't following my train of thought. "Like what? What is it that takes you that much time?"
I just laughed. "You don't need to know." I released a sigh as I tried standing up again. "Anyway, I think we talked about everything that needed to be talked about. I'll be taking my leave now."
I stood up and headed out for the door as the Emperor quickly followed right behind me. However, as soon as we left the room, the two of us couldn't believe the scene before us.
The Empress and Amelia were laughing as they continued to chat with one another.
"Did he really do that?" The Empress asked as she kept laughing. "He really asked you to hug him longer to 'make sure' that it was the best one he ever had?"
"I swear! He really did… though, it did work on me," Amelia muttered, her face completely red.
It seemed they still hadn't noticed that we were watching them as they continued to talk about all kinds of embarrassing things about both me and the Emperor.
"Haha, James also did some embarrassing things trying to seduce me. After all, I always refused him at the beginning, no matter how much he tried to charm me with his influence and power…" The Empress laughed.
"Um, um." The Emperor coughed, catching both of their attentions.
Instantly, they closed their mouths.
"We finished our talk, and Caedrel is now leaving. You should probably head out with him."
"Already?" Amelia sighed. "Tsk, but I was having such a good time. Please, babe, can't we stay a bit longer? I want to continue talking with Laura!"
I looked over to the Emperor, and he shook his head.
"No, Amelia, we're leaving. I need to go and prepare for classes. After all, I'm still a professor, though I'm not a spy for the Emperor anymore."

chapters.title: Chapter 170 - 169 - Seeing Ava Again
chapters.content:
One hour went by, and I was finally back at the Royal Academy. It had been more than three months since I had been in this place, so it was definitely nice to be back here after accomplishing so much.
On the way to my personal room with Amelia, I hadn't crossed paths with any of the professors. The students were certainly very interested in all of the actions that I had taken recently.
"Is that the new professor of the Apex Class?" One of them had muttered.
"I think so… but didn't you see the news that the director gave? Wasn't he supposed to be replaced by someone else?"
"Yeah, well, that's what was said. I guess there were some problems with his methods. I heard that he was torturing some of his students."
"Well, he even killed Professor Derek in cold blood; he's deranged, that's for sure."
I heard all those things but continued to walk toward my room. However, when I heard that the director wanted to replace me, I was even fuming more. There was a big chance that she wouldn't be the director of this academy once I was done with her.
And I'm sure the director wouldn't care too much about Alexandra being demoted since she had lied to him about my message. Without a doubt, she deserved what was coming for her.
Nevertheless, there were also some comments about Amelia, who was practically stuck around my arm as we walked in the vast hallways of the Royal Academy. Some commented on her beauty, some wondered why she was so close to me… There was bound to be a bunch of rumors that would spread soon enough within the academy.
Still, I didn't care.
"Amelia, can you stay here for the next hour or so? I have some business with another professor."
I was obviously talking about Ava. However, I thought that the best decision was for them not to meet just yet, considering that Amelia knew that there was someone who was interested in me within the Royal Academy. After all, I had told her multiple times that there was someone waiting for me in this kingdom.
Considering how jealous and possessive she could get, I didn't want them to meet right now, as it would just give me a bunch of headaches.
"Where are you going? Are you going to see the director?"
I shook my head. "No, just a fellow professor who had I asked something before leaving for the Snowy Mountains. Don't worry. It shouldn't take too long."
Amelia pouted. "Tsk, why can't I meet her? Are you trying to hide things from me?"
I rolled my eyes all the way to the back of my mind, annoyed. "Just stay here. Can you do that for me?"
Amelia wanted to argue as she opened her mouth, but she closed it right away when she noticed the serious look on my face. This wasn't up to discussion.
"Tsk, alright. I'll stay here, but you better give me a reward because I listened…" She looked away, blushing right away.
"A reward?" I frowned. "What kind of reward were you thinking of?"
She shrugged. "Y-You know… maybe a kiss, or something… more?"
I smirked. She really loved me; she had always wanted some physical touch from me. I also loved touching her body. However, I wasn't at the point where I was obsessed just like her. That was another level of crazy.
"Sure, we can have some 'alone' time later…"
She smiled brightly, extremely happy. "Perfect! Come back as soon as possible… I-I'll prepare something special for you this time."
I wasn't too sure what she meant by that. However, I knew that it would be something that I would like since she was so shy about it. I couldn't wait to see what it was. But I still had to go and see Ava to talk about whether she had made some discoveries about the black heart I had given to her. If she had found what the demons were doing to those monsters, then it would surely give me some ideas about how they are currently demonizing people left and right.
"See you in an hour…" I said as I left my office, leaving Amelia behind to prepare for whatever she had in mind.
Quickly enough, I found my way to Ava's lab, where I could hear a ton of noise even while I was outside of it. I peeked at the insides of it through the window, and what I saw inside was… let's say, just a little crazy.
I could see things exploding in every corner of the room; an object was even flying around the room, clearly out of control. And there was Ava with her beautiful purple hair, panicking as she watched everything around her, losing her mind.
Instead of watching her destroy her lab with her own hands, I decided to get involved as I opened the door and controlled most of the things flying around in the room.
