Instantly, Ava looked in my direction as her jaw dropped and her eyes widened in shock. After all, I hadn't told her that I was coming to see her today at all, so she was bound to be extremely shocked by it.
"C-Caedrel? Is it really you? What the hell are you doing here? Weren't you taking a break after everything that happened in the Snowy Mountains? Why are you back so early?"
"Uh… I don't know. I just came back, haha."
Then, she started walking in my direction and gave me a big, tight hug, just like the ones that Amelia would usually give me. She seemed really happy to see me again.
"I missed talking to you… the Royal Academy wasn't the same without."
I just patted her head slightly, not even wrapping my arms around her.
"I want you to tell me about everything that happened in the Snowy Mountains!" She exclaimed excitedly as she slowly let go of me.

chapters.title: Chapter 171 - 170 - Nothing
chapters.content:
"Uh… maybe later," I answered, as I wasn't too keen on telling her about it, especially since I would have no choice but to mention Amelia.
Anyway, I hadn't come here to catch up on lost time. I wanted to know what she had discovered with the black heart I had given her back then. I wanted to know if she might have made a discovery, and if she didn't, then I had another plan in my mind that should give me more results.
I would have to go and see an old friend of mine… someone who was even more crazy about research and things of that sort. However, she was a little annoying, so I hoped that I wouldn't have to do so.
"Alright, alright… then why did you come here for?" She asked with a bright smile.
She was definitely extremely excited to see me and clearly wanted to talk a lot with me. However, I just thought that it would be very awkward, so I was trying my best to keep the conversation going on the demons and less about what happened while I was gone.
"So, did you notice anything weird from any of the professors while I was gone?" I asked, thinking if she had a clue about a demon that was within the Royal Academy.
"Nope, didn't get the slightest clue about that. So, either, they are very discreet. Or there aren't any left within the Royal Academy."
Still, I doubted the fact that Derek was the only one. There was a chance that it was a student. However, I didn't think so. I was actually almost convinced that it would be a teacher or someone who had some importance to him, and a student wasn't something that fit in my opinion.
What was good for a demonic being to study at the academy. It seemed like a waste of time, in my opinion.
"I see. What about the black heart that I gave you before leaving. Did you find out something about it?" I asked as this was really what I was looking forward to.
This was crucial. We needed to find a way to cure the monsters of their demonization… or figure out a way to stop it from happening.
However, the latter mostly seemed impossible to do, in all honesty, since they could always find new beasts. We needed a cure more than anything else. That's what truly mattered at the moment. Everything else was secondary without a doubt in my mind.
"That black heart… uh, it's complicated. Follow me."
Then, she walked me through her lab toward the center of it, where I finally managed to get a glimpse of it. I could see that she had definitely run a lot of tests on it because of the state it was currently in.
I wasn't sure what she had done. But surely, she had worked on the task I had given her.
"I was actually working on it before you entered… that's why it was a little messy inside my lab."
'Just a little?' I thought, my eyes widening at those words. 'It was definitely more than a little.'
It seemed that Ava was also picking up on my definition of the word "little". I had definitely influenced her quite a bit.
"So, what did you discover about it?" I asked with a frown as I continued to stare at it.
"Yeah… that's the thing, no matter how hard I tried to play around with it. I could never even pierce it and absorb some of the blood inside it, which was crucial to finding something concrete. That's why I was using all those explosions; I wanted to gather some blood from it. But I just couldn't, as if it was defending itself against me."
I clicked my tongue. I didn't like where this discussion was currently going. As far as I could tell, it was as if Ava hadn't managed to make a single discovery about it, which meant that the three months I had given her were completely useless all around.
"So, did you find anything that could help us find a cure to return this heart back to normal?"
Ava looked away from me, her shoulders dropping, and honestly, I didn't need to hear her say anything to know that there was something wrong with her at the moment.
"Don't be mad… alright?"
"I won't be, don't worry."
"Promise me."
"I promise; now go on, tell me."
"I… didn't find anything that could help you. I'm sorry. I know you counted on me. But no matter how hard I tried, I couldn't find anything interesting about it. You should try asking another alchemist or someone better than me at that stuff… they might be able to find something interesting then."
I nodded, already expecting such an answer based on how she had just acted. "I see. That's fine, don't worry."
"Really? You're not mad?"
"Of course not; why would I be? You tried to help, and that's all that matters to me. Anyway, I'll just go and ask one of my friends from the war; I think they might find something."
Ava nodded with a bright smile, happy that her performance didn't disappoint me too much.
"So… now that's done, can't you tell me a little about your adventures in the Snowy Mountains."
I clicked my tongue and sighed at the same time.
"You know… maybe later. I really have some things to do right now. I need to go and see the director. I need to talk to her about some things, and I'm kinda tired from all this traveling. So, let's talk later, alright?"
She nodded. "Sure… later then."
With that said, I headed toward the director's office since my visit to see Ava had taken a lot less time than I had anticipated.
Still, I couldn't wait to see what Alexandra would have to say once I entered her office. It had better be good; otherwise, she wouldn't be very happy to see me, that's for sure.

chapters.title: Chapter 172 - 171 - Meeting Alexandra Again
chapters.content:
I didn't bother to knock on her door before entering. I didn't think she deserved the slightest respect for what she had tried to pull against me. She had tried to lie to the Emperor about my actions, something so despicable that she deserved everything that would be headed in her direction.
I walked right, and I saw them sitting on her chair, writing on some kind of paper; her head suddenly rose because of the noise I had made entering.
Still, she didn't look surprised to see, nor did she look panicked.
She seemed relaxed, not worried whatsoever about what I would be doing next.
In fact, she barely even greeted me as she just sighed and said, "Ah… so you're finally back, took you long enough."
I could feel myself fuming at those words; however, I did my best to keep calm. I didn't want to attack her right away; I wanted to know about the reasons for her actions.
Why had she lied to the Emperor? Why had she followed me all the way to the ancient tribe's village? Why had she asked for a student to look at me, even taking videos of myself?
Those actions were definitely strange, and they were not something that I had expected out of a director.
"I am. And I talked a little with the Emperor before coming here. Do you know what he told me?"
I tried to apply pressure in whatever way I could. However, she still did not care in the slightest.
"Oh, you talked to him. That's good, we don't want misunderstandings to spread, right?"
I clenched my jaw at those words. "He told me that you delivered the message I gave you to him. However, it seems you changed some of its content."
"I did?" She smirked, still writing down. "That's strange. Maybe it was because of how panicked I was when you gave it to me, considering that you were on the verge of attacking and maybe even killing me…"
Ah, so that's the route she was going for. I was wondering why she was so relaxed. But did she honestly believe that I would care about such things? Of course not.
Why would I care about some pathetic excuses?
"I see. Then maybe you panicked when you gave your phone number to Jackson so that he could call you and give you our position? That must be why, right?"
She finally raised her head and smiled before answering, "Actually, that wasn't the reason. I was just worried about the students, so I asked him to tell me where you were. After all, the Snowy Mountains are a really dangerous place that isn't suited for first-year students. That's the only reason why I did such a thing."
She was trying to say that she cared about students. It was honestly laughable and clearly false.
However, I still kept my calm as I walked over to the chair before her desk and sat down, placing both my feet on her desk without a care in the world.
"So," I smirked. "Are you going to keep pretending that you didn't do anything wrong, or will you admit it? I'm just warning you, but depending on your answers, my actions will vary."
Alexandra did not even hesitate. "What are you talking about? I didn't do anything wrong."
And that right there was too much to handle. Did she really think that I did not have the balls to attack her on the academy grounds? There's no way she would be so stupid as to think such a thing, right?
I retracted my feet from her desk, which was filled with all kinds of letters and documents. I walked around her desk very slowly, before standing right beside her as she kept her eyes fixated on the documents before her.
"If I were you, I wouldn't try anything. It wouldn't be good for your reputation."
Ok, this time, she really made me laugh.
Reputation?
Did I look like I cared about something like that?
"Reputation? Are you really that stupid that you never noticed that I couldn't give two shits about that?" I continued to smirk. "If I want to, I can slam your head on the desk right there and make you a fucking cripple."
"I don't think you realize who the fuck you're talking to. I'm not some random soldier that you can order around. I'm Caedrel Stuart, the first Sage to have appeared after centuries, so either bow your head down and admit your faults or… I don't even want to think about it."
However, even with those threats, she remained calm. It made me think that something was wrong. However, there was nothing that I could see that would indicate such a thing. There was no reason for me to even be slightly worried, but even then, I was overthinking.
"What are you doing? Weren't you going to slam my head onto my desk?" She asked with a smile as she looked back in my direction. "Oh, powerful Sage…"
Did I just dream just now?
Did she really mock me?
"You really didn't make this any easier on yourself, huh? Well, if that's what you want. Then that's what you will get."
"Yeah, go ahead. Beat me up so that you can feel satisfied…" She continued. "However, I don't think you will beat me up. Do you know why?"
"Why?" I asked because I was truly on the verge of slamming her head against the desk before me.
"Because you know that everything I did isn't something deserving of such things. All I did was actually what I said beforehand. I was worried about the students, and I never tried to betray humanity. I'm not a demon; sure, I did lie to the Emperor. But I did it because you are unhinged. No one can control you, so I thought it was better for you to be discarded from our alliance." She continued to smile at those words, convinced that I wouldn't do anything. "You said it yourself. You are a Sage, someone capable of wielding all the powers in this world. You're stronger than I will ever be. However, what good is that power if you continue to act as you wish."
"The Emperor will never tell you. But he is certainly scared of you and the actions you take. Isn't it normal? After all, if you really wanted to, you could probably take over the entirety of the Human Kingdom. The only reason why you aren't doing it is probably because you think it's a bother or something along those lines. That's why I lied to the Emperor. And that's why I don't think you won't hit me. I didn't do anything 'wrong' at the end of the day."
I wasn't sure what to say to those words because of how stupid they sounded.
Did she really think that such a speech would make me not want to beat her up?
Yes, I'm unhinged.
Yes, I do whatever the fuck I want.
Who wouldn't? I have so much strength that I could take over the human kingdom without a doubt.
She doesn't even know of my connections with some of the strongest people in the world. She doesn't even know who my master is. She ignores so many things about me, but she dares to comment on me.
Her reasons for her actions are not good ones. At least, not to my eyes. They are pathetic reasons to make her feel better, and truth be told, I just wanted to fucking punch that resting bitch face she has.
"Well, you guessed wrong. I want you gone, and you will be gone after I'm done with you. Even the Emperor doesn't trust you anymore because of your lies, and do you really think he will do something if I kill you right now?"
"Kill me if you want. I said what I had to say."
Then, she turned her head back toward her documents and continued writing as if I wasn't there in the first place.
However, it only made me more angry. That arrogant behavior was the reason why I was here. If only she knew her place… none of this would have even happened in the first place.
"Before I do what I have to do, I have one question, and I want you to answer it truthfully. Are there any other demons who have infiltrated the Academy?"
She smiled at those words and looked back to face me. "Maybe, all I will say is that you should be careful who you share the information you gather with. When we found out about Derek, we observed all the professors closely, and you wouldn't even believe me if I told you who we believe to be a demon."
I didn't have to be a genius to know who she was talking about. I was close with a single professor… Ava.
"You really think she's one?"
Alexandra shrugged. "Maybe, who knows? You should probably look into it. Find out who the demons hiding within the Academy are. It shouldn't be too hard for you, oh powerful Sage."

chapters.title: Chapter 173 - 172 - Revealing Secrets.
chapters.content:
I smirked. She really was pushing it this time.
She was so sarcastic with her respect, convinced that I wouldn't do anything after that shitty explanation of hers.
Did she think I was weak and wouldn't do anything against someone who had wronged me?
Well, if she did, then she was wrong. Without a doubt, she was dead wrong about me.
"I'll show you who's really this, oh powerful sage as you like saying," I muttered as I grabbed her by the back of her collar, lifting her up to my eye level and giving her a good look. "Say goodbye to your job at this academy, and more importantly, say goodbye to your reputation."
It was time to humiliate her in front of everyone present in the academy. I could see all of her magic beasts glaring at me, especially that stupid owl of hers. However, I couldn't care less, I flew out of the open window where the owl from back then had flown through, still onto her.
"You're worse than I thought. Attacking someone who didn't do anything," she said, her voice still calm even now, which only made me angrier.
Still, I ignored her as I felt the rage within myself bubbling even further.
On the ground, a few students directly noticed me and pulled out their cellphones, taking videos.
"Who is flying up there?"
"I-Is that the Director? Since when can she fly? Does she have a white core?"
"W-Wait, there's someone behind her!"
I spotted them, and in a swift movement of my hand, I made all their cellphones levitate, and I also erased their memories of me flying, I made sure to do that with everyone present. Since I didn't want rumors to spread. Anyway, I reached the ground quickly, landing without much problem.
Right away, I held Alexandra before me, raising her for everyone to see.
"What the hell is happening? Why is the director being held by the teacher of the Apex Class? What the hell is happening?"
"This is crazy!"
I just smirked as I could see more and more students and teachers approaching. This was all I wanted for what would be coming next.
I wanted everyone to see the director get humiliated. I wanted it to be bad.
I could see some of my own students approaching, all looking at me as if I had lost my mind. I even spotted Ava, who had her hair all disheveled, probably wondering what I was doing. There was even my girlfriend, Amelia, who had come out, and sure enough, within minutes, the backyard of the Royal Academy was filled with all kinds of different people as they all glared at me, wondering what I would be doing next.
I had kept quiet ever since I had arrived there. With practically every teacher and student bombarding me with questions about why I was doing this, my reasons for capturing the director in such a way…
Still, I kept calm. There was no reason for me to be nervous at the moment.
"Quiet." I finally uttered as everyone within the crowd shut their mouths at my word.
I had enough aura that a single word coming from my mouth was enough for everyone around to shut their mouths at once.
"I know everyone is wondering why I'm holding onto Alexandra, the director of this academy, without the slightest care in the world, right?" I smirked. "Well, it's because she's not as she seems, and after today, she will have no choice but to either get fired or leave on her own. There will be no in-between."
Everyone seemed still confused. However, I was only starting.
"Alexandra here is a manipulative little bitch who used her connections with the Emperor to get to her spot. She's a little snake that decided to lie to the Emperor in my stead, spreading rumors about me within the human kingdom that I had betrayed humankind. Of course, such rumors only spread within the high society; however, they are still because of her."
I started laughing.
"It's honestly really funny that someone like Alexandra could utter such words. Someone who never went to the battlefield for seven years to fight against the demons. Someone who didn't have to kill his friends because they had been demonized. Someone who just stayed here all cooped up without the slightest thing while I was on the fucking battlefield. While I was the one risking my life so that everyone present here could be in peace."
I started losing my mind, laughing even harder.
"I'm sure everyone must be wondering what happened to Professor Derek, right? Well, guess what, he was a fucking demon. Demons are still here; we won the war, but it was only a diversion for them to infiltrate our societies. It was a secret that the Emperor wanted to keep away from everyone, and I thought that it was a good idea to do that. But I'm tired of getting played and shit on when I'm doing fucking everything for this world."
"Without me, we would have lost the war. Without me, we wouldn't have figured out that there were high-ranked officials in all kingdoms that are demons dissimulated as normal people."
I shook my head, trying to calm down and take a small breather. But I just couldn't. I was fuming. Everything that I had kept hidden from others was starting to come out on its own.
"None of you here experienced what it's like to be at war. Well, you'll find out soon enough just how horrible it is. After all, our enemy is a single entity that no one can rival. The Demon King. That is our enemy, someone so powerful that no one in this world can even hope to resist a single strike from him. However, our enemy isn't important. I am here today to tell everyone that the demons are still present within our world."
I could already murmur within the crowd as I had just revealed information that I hadn't even planned on revealing. I had wanted to humiliate Alexandra, but that's not exactly what I had done. Anyway, after saying that, I looked directly toward Ava, I still remembered the words from the director. That there was a chance that she was actually a demon.
I didn't believe her, considering everything that had happened around her… the fact that she had told me about the Cyclops with someone coming to my class to demonize him… Too many things were weird about this situation.
Still, the fact that she hadn't found anything related to the black heart was strange. At the very least, she should have managed to get some clue on it. But nothing… she had found nothing. It was simply too weird to let it go that easy.
There was clearly something strange related to Ava, and when I looked over in her direction. She was frowning heavily. Obviously, that wasn't that much of an unusual reaction, considering what I had just done. But she seemed angry as if something had angered her greatly.
Alexandra was right. I really needed to look into her. There was something strange that I hadn't noticed because I had been naively getting closer to her… love blinded me? I scoffed just thinking about it… because of how ridiculous that sounded.
While everyone started to panic, Alexandra, who I was still holding onto, looked at me with a sigh.
"Are you really happy with what you just done? Now, the whole world will be thrown into a state of panic, wondering if their friends or their family aren't demons… and I just want you to know that it's all because of you."
"I don't care. It's better this way. Keeping it a secret was just helping the demons more than anything since they could roam with only a few individuals knowing. Now that everyone knows, it'll be much harder for Perdere to move. Anyway, I expect your resignation to happen tomorrow, or I'll come to your office personally and cripple you so that you won't be able to work another day in your life."
I said that in a whisper, making sure no one else could hear it.
Alexandra just nodded quietly, knowing that I would do it.
"Fine. Congrats, you got what you wanted, I guess. Chaos." She shrugged. "Still… remember what I said, with what you did by killing Zero. Demons will try to take revenge on you; don't let them get too much information on you. Because if I were the siblings of Zero, I would be only thinking of killing you right at this moment."
I laughed. "I welcome them. They can come. The same fate will happen to them."
Alexandra just shook her head as she couldn't be bothered anymore. "You should quit being a professor at the academy; it'll only make things harder for you. You need to focus on the war against the demons… You said it yourself; you're probably the most important person we have right now. You're the one who knows the most, and you're also the one who's at the most risk of getting killed."

chapters.title: Chapter 174 - 173 - Assassination Attempt
chapters.content:
A week had passed since the incident I had caused in the middle of the Royal Academy, and let's say that a lot of things had happened during that short moment.
The first thing that happened was that Alexandra resigned from her position as the director of the Royal Academy on her own. I hadn't done anything about that.
However, what was truly the "big" part of this whole thing were the articles circulating everywhere about me.
It was the first time in my life that there was a 'spotlight' on me and my actions. Questions were being thrown around quite heavily as it seemed that I had entered the crossfire of most media around the world. After all, they probably looked up information on me and never found anything.
That's why most articles that came had similar titles, which were honestly clickbait titles.
[Mystery Man declares that Demons have infiltrated society!]
[An Unknown Man Announces that Demons are Back!]
As I was looking through those articles on my desk, I couldn't help but be annoyed when I read them. They were so badly written that most of them ignored the facts, hearing them from bystanders who had been panicked by my actions.
Most of those articles painted me in a bad light. It was as if I had been the one who had done something wrong when I was the one who had just revealed the truth to everyone across the world.
Was that fair? No way.
Still, now that a week had passed, I had spent a bit of time with Amelia, and I had observed Ava.
To be honest, Ava seemed clean, as far as I could tell. There was nothing about her that could make me think that she was 100% a demon. I had even asked her if she was one straight to her face, and my lie detector skill had indicated that she was telling the truth.
I knew that it wasn't 100% sure. But it was better than nothing.
That's why I quickly dismissed my worries about Ava being a demon. Instead, I focused on what I should be doing next.
There was only one thing that I really needed to do at the moment, and that was to figure out that Black Heart and how they had managed to demonize humans and others to such a degree without anyone noticing. Derek had used a skill to change his appearance. But the Ice Elves I had met hadn't.
They were literally demons, but they appeared to be normal. That was the thing that worried me the most. The fact that there was no way to tell them apart from normal people. If it continued to develop this way, there would be no way to win this war, no matter what I tried to pull off.
That's why today was the day that I announced to all my students that I was departing once more.
This time, I decided to let them stay at the Academy because I thought it would be safer than being around me for one simple reason.
The fact that I had killed Zero.
Alexandra was clearly right about what she had said about his siblings. They would try to get revenge against me soon. And I did not want them to use my students to do so. I could handle them. They couldn't.
Nevertheless, you must be wondering where I was going, right?
Well, it was to see a good friend of mine.
Someone who was known around the world as the best alchemist.
She had been the one I thought of at first when I discovered the Black Hearts in the monsters I had killed. However, there was just one reason why I hadn't given them to her. She was quite far from the Human Kingdom.
She resided within the Elf Kingdom, which was the place that I would be heading next.
The Elf Kingdom was on the opposite side of the Snowy Mountains, in the South. There was also another reason why I had wanted to find information without contacting her. It was the fact that… our relationship wasn't the best. Let's say that we weren't exactly on friendly terms.
Still, I was ready to endure her hatred if it meant that I could get information about the Black Heart.
I took back the Black Heart that I had given to Ava, and I was finally ready to leave for the Human Kingdom.
However, I wouldn't be leaving alone. Amelia was accompanying me. I had tried my best to make her stay here, but no matter what I tried to say or pull, it was useless. There was nothing I could do, she was decided. And honestly, it would be nice to have her around and have someone to "distract" me.
"Ready to leave?" I asked Amelia.
"Yes! I've never been to the South Region! I can't wait to see how it is over there."
I smiled at her naiveness. However, I was also unaware of how the South was. I had never been. I had only heard a few rumors, such as that it was just one big mystical. And I had also heard that elves, in general, despised humans.
Still, I wasn't too worried about their hatred. After all, everyone I met loved me. Right?
***
It took around a week once more to reach the South Region, but we had finally arrived at the mystical forest that I had heard about so many times.
We had already ventured inside a little, and it was certainly unlike anything I had seen before. The energy within the forest was some of the purest I had felt in my life, but that wasn't all. I didn't know what it was, but there was something strange about this forest and the energy it was emitting. In fact, it had managed to block off some of my senses ever so slightly.
"Do you feel anything different about this place?" I asked Amelia as soon as I realized it.
"What do you mean?" She muttered with a look of confusion. "Am I supposed to feel something different?"
"Your senses? Is there anything strange about them?"
"Nope, they seem fine."
'Hm…' I thought.
That meant either one of two things. Either Amelia wasn't affected because she was technically an elf, or she couldn't feel the slight oppression of our skills.
As we continued to walk in the forest, I made sure to pay attention as much as I could, even with my senses reduced in terms of strength.
-Bwoong!
A loud noise suddenly resounded on my right side as if a piercing noise was heading toward me.
"Amelia, dodge!" I shouted as fast I could as I turned my head toward the arrow heading in our direction.
If I had reacted 0.01 seconds later, we would have most likely been both dead. Still, as I dodged, I tried to look around, but I couldn't feel or sense anyone's presence, which made it even clearer that something was weird about this place.
"Who's there!" I shouted as I couldn't sense their position, no matter how hard I tried. I wasn't sure why, but this forest was making things harder for me… "Show yourselves! We are not here to attack the elves or anything like that, please."
I was practically convinced that it was elves who were currently attacking Amelia and me; however, I still found it quite strange that they had not announced themselves or tried to ask us why we were in their territory. It was definitely strange and something that stayed in the back of my mind as I continued to try and spot those who had just tried to kill us.
"Grrrr…"
I turned around when I heard the growl, and what I saw was troubling. Before me, at the very least, fifteen demonic beasts are staring me down.
Alright, scratch that. The ones who attacked me are part of Perdere, without a doubt.
The energy I felt from the demonic creatures was different from those I had met before… they were much stronger, and their demonic energy was much worse than anything he had felt from a beast before.
'The situation regarding the Black Hearts just keeps getting worse as time passes… I need to move faster.'
Without saying another word, I dashed forward at the beasts, killing every one of them with my sword without much struggle. After all, they were simple beasts; they were no match against me. Still, it was clear as I fought them that there was someone who was telling them what to do and how to fight against me.
-Bwoong!
Another arrow passed right before my eyes, and once more, I couldn't feel the presence of the one who had shot it. The people currently attacking me were certainly very powerful assassins whose only goal was to assassinate me one way or another.
'Wait… what about Amelia?' I suddenly thought as I realized that I had stopped paying attention to her because of the wolves.
And for some reason, my sense of hearing seemed to have stopped working, as I could no longer hear those around me. Instead, a constant high-pitched noise was resounding in my head, again and again.
And when I turned toward where I had last left Amelia, I finally saw the face of one of the people who had just tried to kill me. It was a demon, just like I had guessed, and he was currently holding a knife against Amelia's neck, threatening to kill her.
"Move, and she's dead, Caedrel Stuart," the demon muttered, his voice dark and gloomy.

chapters.title: Chapter 175 - 174 - Aelua Lumoira (1)
chapters.content:
I wasn't sure what to do at the moment.
Amelia was currently being held up with a knife by her throat while I was over 20 meters away from her, and more importantly, the person holding the knife was skilled. I could tell from the aura he was exuding.
If I were to fight against him alone, he wouldn't be powerful or come close to hurting me. However, since he now had Amelia, things were getting complicated. It was definitely a situation that I had never come across in my life until now.
I had cared about people in the past, but not as much as I did with Amelia. Most of the time, in those situations, I would continue fighting as if nothing was happening. But this time, I stopped moving… I didn't want Amelia to die. I finally had someone with whom I could spend my life with. I hadn't told her about my secrets, but it was only a matter of time before I revealed my past to Amelia…
"Ha! Ha! Ha!" The demon laughed evilly as he noticed the hesitation in my movements. "It's probably the first time that I see the great Caedrel Stuart hesitating… what is it?" He turned his head toward Amelia. "You care about her that much?"
I didn't answer. There was no point in doing that. Instead, I needed to think of a way to save her and analyze the situation.
First, I knew that this man wasn't alone. He was the only one who had shown himself, but there was at least an archer hiding in the trees. However, I could not find him because the forest was playing tricks on my senses.
Second, the elves should have heard or, at the very least, noticed this fight, which means that there should be some of them heading in my direction as we speak.
Third, there was nothing I could do that would certainly save Amelia's life at the moment, and I didn't want to gamble her life.
That's why my decision was a simple one. I needed to gain time until the elves' soldiers or guards reached our position. I wasn't sure how far away the elves' kingdom was, but I decided to give them a time limit. If they didn't reach my position in 30 minutes, then I would have no choice but to act on my own and gamble Amelia's life.
'Let's hope that you guys get here in time.'
After all, I had the upper hand here since I knew that those demons weren't here for Amelia. They were here for my head. They wanted to kill me. I just needed to make them think that I would let them kill me in exchange for her life.
"Let her go," I muttered in a dark and gloomy tone similar to the one the demon had used beforehand.
"Ha! Ha! Ha! I don't think I will!" The demon continued laughing as he saw my discomfort.
"What do you want?"
My strategy was simple, gaining time. And that started by talking.
"Isn't that obvious? Give us your head, and we won't kill her."
"Don't do it, Caedrel! Don't worry, they won't do anything to me!"
As Amelia opened her mouth, the person holding her tightened his hold around her neck, choking her mercilessly.
"Don't open your mouth again, you fucking whore."
I was fuming, and I had been close to just running in his direction to protect her. But I kept my calm. I needed to show that Amelia wasn't someone who could dictate my actions because once I did, a target would appear on her back as well, and they would continue to pressure me with her.
"You really think I will surrender because you're holding onto a girl?" I asked with a smirk. "I guess your superiors didn't tell you much about me, huh?"
I took a step forward, my aura spreading.
"Now. If you want to kill me, just fight me. I won't give up my life for a girl. If you want my head, you should kill me right now. Otherwise, you would have lost your opportunity to do so since as soon as I enter the elves' kingdom, you won't be able to touch me. At least, not publicly like this."
My words were the ones of truth. I truly wouldn't give my life away for Amelia. As much as I loved her, it wasn't worth it. I would do my best to save her, but I wouldn't surrender my life to her. It was simply not worth it for humanity.
The demon holding onto her also knew this. However, he also knew that I cared about her.
"Is that so? Then, I guess we no longer need her!" He said with a shrug as the knife that was placed right against Amelia's jugular brushed against her neck, blood slowly running down her neck ever so slightly.
"NO!"
My body moved on its own as I saw that the demon was really planning on killing her without any mercy.
However, as I ran as fast as I could, the demon stopped his movement…
"Hm, you really do care about her… interesting."
Then, as he was about to say something else, there were footsteps heading in our direction. They were loud, and a lot of people were coming in our direction. I already knew who they were without even looking.
The elves.
"I guess we'll see each other soon, Caedrel…" the demon said as a small portal appeared right behind him. He walked through it while holding Amelia in his arms.
"AMELIA!"
"CAEDREL!"
I ran as fast as I could, my eyes turning bloodshot. However, the portal was closing faster than I moved… and by the time I had reached it, it had closed… and the demon who had captured Amelia was gone right before my eyes.
'Why didn't I think of this…' I clenched my fists because of how stupid I had been. 'Of course, they had means to escape! They wouldn't come here without the slightest plan.'
I hit the ground with my fists, and a shock wave occurred because of the impact…
I was angry. I had been stupid. I had tried to rely on something other than me, and because of that, I had failed. Now that Amelia had been captured by Perdere, who knows what they would do to her.
Torturing her for answers was the most logical avenue…
'Torture. Let's hope you can handle it by the time that I find you…' I thought as I clenched my fists once more, blood running down the palms of my hands.
However, I had no idea where they had taken her, probably their headquarters. But I had no idea where they were even located… one thing was sure, Amelia would be suffering because of my actions.
"That's always what happens when someone gets close to me… they end up getting hurt because of me. This is all my fucking fault… it's always my fault."
I could only blame myself. I knew that I shouldn't have brought Amelia with me to the elves' kingdom. But I conceded even when I knew that it was dangerous and that something wrong could happen. I should have forced her to stay in the human kingdom…
"Fuck…I'm stupid. I'm so stupid…"
As I continued to ramble on by myself, the elves, which had been the ones causing all this ruckus, finally arrived. They all glared at me as if I was some kind of grand enemy that they needed to take down.
"Who are you?" A beautiful, golden-haired elf uttered, looking down at me from the tree branch she was standing on. "And why did you cause so much destruction within the magical forest of Mother Nature?"
I knew that I needed to explain myself. If I didn't, then they would also try to kill me.
"My name is Caedrel Stuart. I was just attacked by a few demons who tried to assassinate me. My girlf-, my friend has also been captured by them just now."
As soon as I uttered my name, murmurs were spread within the group of elven soldiers.
It seemed they had heard of me because of the articles going around about me. Honestly, it was probably the first time that someone recognized me… it was a strange feeling, but it wasn't one that I hated all in all.
"Can you give us proof of your identity?"
"Uh…" I rambled in my spacial pouch, trying to find something. "Just a second."
After a few more seconds of searching through my stuff, I pulled out an article about me. I had decided to keep a few in my spacial pouch as a memory of sorts. However, never in a million years would I have thought that it would serve in such a situation.
In the article, there was a big picture of me holding onto Alexandra by the neck.
"Here, would that do?"
The beautiful golden-haired elf observed it and frowned slightly at the article. After all, it wasn't the most flattering one for me… still, it wasn't like everyone would get articles written about them.
"What is your purpose for coming to the elven kingdom?" She asked after a few moments.
"I'm here to meet up with an old friend."
"Who is she? Give me her name."
"Aelua Lumoira."
The eyes of all elves widened at the same time I uttered her name.
"You… how do you know that name?"
"I told you, she's just an old friend of mine. Now, then, could we please head to the elven kingdom. It's not that I'm in a hurry… but I sort of am now that my friend was kidnapped."

chapters.title: Chapter 176 - 175 - Aelua Lumoira (2)
chapters.content:
After reading through the article, I realized that the elven soldiers had guided me to the elven kingdom, which was not that far away from the position where Amelia and I had been fighting.
As soon as we arrived, I could feel that there was definitely a strange feeling in the atmosphere, probably because of my presence. All the elves just kept staring at me as we walked through the bustling streets. However, they did so in silence. It was the look in their eyes that told me a lot about their inside thoughts.
"Hey, could you untie me?" I asked with a sigh. "It's not like I did anything bad."
"No. You won't be untied until we verify what you have just told us."
Ever since I had mentioned her name, this whole situation had escalated to a whole other level. It seemed that she was a very important person within the elven kingdom, too. With her talent, it wasn't anything surprising, though. It was actually very normal.
However, there was one thing that was worrying me. The fact that I wasn't on good terms with Aelua at the moment.
***
It took a few more minutes, but we had finally reached what seemed to be the biggest building within the entire kingdom.
I entered it, and it looked eerily similar to the Ice Castle. This time, it wasn't made out of ice but other luxurious materials that certainly cost a lot. There was once more a throne at the end of the long and wide hall, and there was once someone sitting upon it.
This time, it wasn't a woman but a man. This kingdom had a king, and as far as he could, the aura he was exuding was definitely the one of a king. He imposed respect with only his presence, which wasn't something that was easily attainable by many.
Amelia, for one, didn't really have that quality. She was feared by some, but she was still betrayed by her own subjects.
The beautiful golden-haired elf from earlier brought me in front of the king as she kneeled down.
"I pay my respects to the king!" The soldiers all uttered at the same time with their heads bowed down.
"Rise." The king muttered.
The atmosphere was definitely different from the Ice Castle. However, I didn't dislike it.
They also didn't attempt to make me bow down, and none of the nobles said anything about it.
"We have found this individual fighting in the Elven Forest, causing problems. Once we arrived, he was completely alone, and he claimed that he was attacked and that a friend of his was kidnapped by demons."
I noticed a slight frown on the face of the king at the mention of the word "demon," which was definitely interesting.
"Demons, are you sure?" The king asked.
However, he wasn't talking to me yet. He was talking to the golden-haired elf right beside me.
"Yes. That's what he is saying. He also said that his name is Caedrel Stuart."
This time, the king's eyes widened all of a sudden. Anyone could see the surprise on his face at the mention of my name. It was the first time that there was such a reaction to hearing my name, and it seemed that my influence and strength were slowly spreading among the kingdoms. However, I welcomed it as long as they still ignored what my 'strength' entailed.
As long as they ignored my abilities, I did not care.
"The Caedrel Stuart?" The king muttered as his eyes suddenly turned in my direction for the very first time. "Hm… seems like it really is him."
"Why have you come to the elven kingdom?" the king suddenly asked. "There must be a reason why you came all the way here. Is it because you believe that there are demons within our society?"
At those words, a few nobles watching from afar couldn't help but speak up.
"Such nonsense. There are no demons among us."
"The humans are just trying to scare us…"
"Why would a nobody like him know so much about this anyway. This 'demon' stuff was clearly all fake!"
One after another, they kept talking, saying that what I had announced a week ago was all lies, which was obviously a lie. However, I didn't bother saying anything. Demons weren't the reason why I was here anyway.
Well, they sort of were, but I wasn't here to kill any demons.
"Well, I do believe that there are demons within you all. That is not the reason why I'm here."
"Hmm, then why is it?"
"I need to meet up with an old friend of mine. You might know her under the name of Aelua Lumoira…"
Once more, her name caused a reaction from the crowd and also the king, who seemed slightly surprised that I knew of her existence.
I could hear murmurs all around me, but I didn't pay them any attention, and neither did the king as he continued speaking.
"Hm… is that so? Could I know where you met Aelua?"
"Ugh… it's complicated. I don't really want to get into it. Is that fine?"
The king frowned because I refused to answer his question.
After all, I doubted that it happened often that someone would refuse to answer him since he had absolute authority over this whole place.
Then, just as the king was about to speak up again, I felt murderous intent directed at me… it had lasted for maybe half of a second, but I had definitely felt it from my left.
My head snapped in that direction as I scattered throughout all the nobles' faces, trying to see who had done such a thing. However, it was impossible for me to figure out such a thing when the murderous had now vanished as if it had never existed in the first place.
'Did I just hallucinate?' I thought, weirded out.
"Is something wrong?" The king asked, noticing my strange behavior as I kept looking around myself.
My eyes drifted back toward him. "Ah… no. Everything fine's. What were you saying?"
"Aelua, where did you meet her? If you don't answer that question, then you will not be able to meet with her."
"During the war, probably on the battlefield or something. I don't really remember. Can't you just bring her here? She'll prove that I knew her right away."
'Though, she might curse me out…' I thought.
The king then stopped talking as he turned to the person on his right, indicating him to get closer to him, and he whispered a few words in his ears.
Then, that person left right away.
It seemed that they would bring her just like I had asked.
'Ah… how long has it been since I've last seen her? I hope she's not too mad about last time…otherwise, this might not go like I have planned.'
***
"Where is that fucking bastard!?"
I started hearing shouts getting louder and louder, coupled with loud footsteps.
"How dare he come after what he did last time? Old friend? Old friend, my ass. We're enemies more than anything else!"
Hearing that, I now knew very well who was making such a ruckus. That was unlike elves nature, who were usually peaceful and extremely calm.
Then, she appeared in my field of vision, walking in with a big frown on her face.
She wasn't wearing anything glamor or fancy that would compliment her figure. She was wearing normal clothes that were just there to be 'there'… Her hair was also short so that it wouldn't be a bother to arrange in the morning. Everything about Aelua screamed one thing and one thing only, efficiency.
"Ah. There you are, you fucking bastard!"
Her eyes locked into mine right away, and she kept glaring at me as if she was about to pounce at me.
I had to admit that I had pulled off quite a disrespectful move on her… but it really wasn't my fault. You had to believe me here.
"Ah, hey, Aelua, been a while. How have you been?"
"How I've been? You dare fucking ask me that after you pulled off?!" She grumbled. "And why the hell did you say we're friends? We're the furthest thing away from being friends."
"Tsk, come on. You know that I was just pulling a joke on you back then. Nothing too bad."
Aelua just couldn't handle it anymore as she shook her head, not wanting to get into this right now, especially in front of everyone in the crowd. It would just make things complicated for no reason.
"Whatever, we'll have a 'nice' and very, very long conversation about it once we're alone."
"Guards, untie him. I want to talk to him. If Caedrel came here unannounced, it's because it's important. He wouldn't be here otherwise; he's not the type of person to waste time."
Aelua didn't even bother asking for the king's opinion, and the king also didn't say anything about her decision. It was as if she was on the same level as the king. Still, I was glad that she hadn't made me an enemy of the elves in front of everyone. That would have been absolutely terrible.

chapters.title: Chapter 177 - 176 - Aelua Lumoira (3)
chapters.content:
In the middle of a luxurious, two people sat facing each other; one of them had a resting face while the other one was on the verge of exploding out of rage.
The one who was calm was obviously me.
While the one who was about to explode in a fit of rage was…
"Caedrel! How dare you ask to see me as if we're friends? How dare you!" She clicked her tongue. "You're lucky that I didn't ask of you to be killed in front of everyone out there. That's the only thing you deserve."
"Ah… Aelua, can't we just forget about the past and act like nothing ever happened between us? Wouldn't that make things easier on the two of us?"
I wanted to remove her memories about me from her mind. However, she had reached a certain level of strength, and it was complicated for me to manipulate her memories for one simple reason.
She would realize that something was amiss, and she would instantly link it back to me, which would create an even bigger scene and would probably make her hate me even more. That's why, every time I met someone very powerful, it was very dangerous for me to touch upon their memories. That's also the reason why I let them keep them…
"I'm not like you. I don't want to forget things and act as if I'm fine when I'm clearly not."
Ouch. That hurt.
"Whatever, I don't even want to talk about what happened back then. It was already horrible as it was; no need to add fuel to the fire, am I right?"
"Sure… I also don't want to talk about it. Anyways," I took out one of the many black hearts from my inventory that I had gathered while traveling all the way and showed it to Aelua.
It took less than a single second for her eyes to be almost sparkling as if she was looking at something that was amazing.
She didn't even say anything as she took it right out of my hands, continuing to observe it.
"Where did you find this?"
"Close to here by killing some monsters."
"Monsters? What are you talking about? This is the heart of a demon, without a doubt. Something like that wouldn't be found inside monsters."
I gave her a knowing look. "Exactly, that's why I'm here."
She nodded slowly, clearly understanding the seriousness of this situation because as much as Aelua might hate me. She was smart, and she knew how to prioritize the right things. That's why I had come up to her. I knew very well that she would be able to help me.
"Do you notice anything strange about it at first glance?" I asked.
What had happened with Ava was also there. I wanted to know if Aelua would be able to find something, and if so, how much time it would take.
Depending on how fast Aelua could find something about it, the stranger it would become that Ava didn't find anything. Of course, they were not anywhere close in terms of strength. But it was still representative of her abilities and whether she had lied or not.
"Yes, there's something very weird about it that any skilled alchemist would see right away."
I frowned right away at those words. "What are you talking about?"
Aelua was surprised by my tone. However, it seemed she understood what was going through my mind.
"Did you show this Black Heart stuff to someone else?"
"I did. I left it to that person for more than three months, and she could not find anything."
"I…" Aelua opened her mouth before closing it just as fast.
"Say what you're thinking. Don't worry about me and my feelings."
"Well, do I even need to say it? I'm telling you, any low-skilled alchemist would find something weird about this heart right away. That should tell you enough about the person you trusted with this."
I clenched my fists. The more I learned about the situation around Ava, the more difficult it was for me to believe that she wasn't with the demons and against them.
"Whatever. I'll deal with that on my own," I replied to Aelua, who could clearly see how annoyed I was at the moment. "What is it that you found? It better be something good."
She smiled. "Glad you asked."
Then, she started pressing her fingers against the heart, some blood oozing out from it.
"Did you see it?" She asked, looking back toward me.
However, I was in the dark about what she wanted to show me. All I could see was blood oozing out… there was nothing strange about this.
"Watch more closely; pay attention at the moment the blood comes out; that's when it happens."
Aelua pressed onto the heart again, and I made sure to look toward one of the holes where a lot of blood came out last time.
And… I noticed something. However, I had no clue what it meant.
When the blood came out, it started out as black, and as soon as it went in outside the heart, it would turn back to red.
"So? Did you see it?"
"Ugh… I think you can't just tell me. It'll be easier that way."
Aelua laughed at my stupidity just like she always did in the past.
"It's about when the blood changes color. You see, that's something that indicates. Whenever the blood from the heart enters in contact with the oxygen of the world, it changes color right away. It makes me think that there is a chance that those monsters could be turned back to their original form if enough oxygen is injected into their veins."
"Still. Take this with a grain of salt. There's a chance that I'm wrong. Nevertheless, you should talk with that alchemist you have this heart to last time. There is definitely something fishy about this, and the fact is that she found out nothing worth telling you about. If I were you, I would definitely keep an eye out for her."
"Don't worry. I'll have a conversation with her as soon as I'm back in the Human Kingdom. Though, that might take a bit of time for the simple reason that my girl-my friend was captured by demons just before I reached this place."
Aelua giggled. "I must have heard that wrong… did you just say 'friend'? Since when does the Caedrel Stuart have friends… weren't you the one who kept saying how relationships are useless in the past. Maybe the war ending changed your views of the world, eh?"
"The war isn't over. And things happened. That's all."
Aelua continued to smile as she observed me, not even bothering to look at the black heart, leaving it on the table as if it was nothing more than a useless twig.
"You definitely changed. Just what happened to you?"
"None of your business. Also, I leave this here with you so that you can look at it. Did you notice any nobles acting strangely for the past week or two… maybe they went missing more. Just tell me if someone wasn't acting normally."
"Ah… I can't help you with that. I barely leave this room. The only reason I came out was because someone told me that you were here to see me. If it was someone else, I would have refused to even meet up with them. If you want to find out more about this, then you should talk to the maids. They should be the ones who know a lot about this stuff."
I nodded, knowing that she would probably ignore this mundane stuff.
"Though, why do you ask? Do you really believe that the demons have managed to infiltrate most kingdoms without anyone realizing it?"
"Yes. And I'm sure that there are a lot of demonic spies in the elven kingdom. I even went to an underground auction where they sold off an elven princess, and a bunch of elves was working there, too."
Aelua frowned but didn't look too angry. After all, she was always this way. She never cared about anything that wasn't related to her.
"I see, that's definitely strange."
"I also felt murderous intent in my direction back in the throne room. However, it was barely noticeable, and it lasted for a fraction of a second. I was the only one in the room who even noticed it, I think."
"Um…the situation might be worse than I thought. Actually, I was thinking of getting out of this place for a little. What do you say about me accompanying you while you go looking for your friend? Who knows… I might be of help."
I didn't think too much about it, as she would definitely be a great addition to the team. She could also defend herself on her own without a doubt. And if we ever crossed paths with one of Zero's siblings, she would also be of great help.
"Alright, let's go."
However, just as we were about to head out, there was a knock on the door.
I looked toward Aelua, wondering if she knew who that was. However, the frown on her face was enough for me to know that she did not.
I turned back around and opened the door slowly, peeking out my head very slightly where I saw a beautiful elven princess on the other side of the door, looking kind of… lost.
"Who are you?" I asked.
I knew from what Aelua told me that she barely ever got visitors, so this was definitely strange.
"Ah… I'm Laura Virdi. It's nice to meet you, sir."

chapters.title: Chapter 178 - 177 - Aelua Lumoira (4)
chapters.content:
I had no idea why, but there was an elf who had decided to pay Aelua a visit. I wasn't sure if Aelua knew her, but from the look on her face at the moment. That didn't seem to be likely.
As far as I could tell, she was here not for Aelua but to see me… which was definitely strange and not something that I would have expected.
"Hi! I'm Laura Virdi. It's really nice to meet you, sir!"
"Ugh… yes?" I wasn't sure what to tell her. "Why are you here?"
But before this conversation could even continue, Aelua got in the way of the two of us.
"I don't know who you are. But it'd be good for you to leave; otherwise, you might lose your noble. You see how the discussions here are private. It's by no means something that you can listen to."
"Is that so?" The unknown elf answered with a frown. "I just wanted to meet with the man who discovered the demons again! I'm a big fan, you see!"
As she said that, a blush formed on her face, and she looked down. She was unable to meet my eyes. It was similar to the behavior Ava had when we first met each other.
"I see, thank you. But Aelua is right. You should leave. This is a private conversation."
The girl nodded. "Just make sure to remember my name, okay?"
I nodded. However, I didn't have too much trust in myself to be doing so.
Anyway, quickly after that, Aelua shut the door and turned in my direction with a slight frown.
"What?" I asked, seeing her behavior.
"That girl, something is weird about her."
"Do you know her?"
Aelua seemed hesitant. "Kind of, I heard of her achievements here and there. But that's not what I meant. There was something weird with how she behaved with you. It was as if she knew very well who you were."
This time, I wasn't too sure what Aelua was trying to say. I thought that everything had gone quite well without anything strange happening.
"You probably didn't notice, but it's how she looked at you… it was as if she knew everything about you. And you must know just how weird such a thing is, especially when it comes to you. Practically no one knows about you… Well, now they have learned just a little from those articles. But that's it. So for her to come all the way here to see you, there is definitely something fishy; I just don't know what it is yet."
"Hm…is that so. Who is she anyway? A princess?"
"Yes, but she didn't become a princess like you may think. She's not a daughter of the king; she became a princess through her achievements."
"That's a thing?"
That seemed pretty weird just thinking about it. To become a noble and a princess through your own achievements. It did make sense in a way, but I didn't think that was a thing in a place like the elven territory. It might explain why there were so many families of novelty.
"Yes, there are two ways to become a noble. Through birth and through your achievements. You might think that the latter is simple, but it isn't. Your achievements need to be truly incredible to become a noble. That girl you just saw was a one-of-a-kind genius within the elven territory. She was unlike anything anyone had ever seen in the past, which is why… I think she's strange. There is something that she's hiding, but I can't tell what it is."
I nodded. What Aelua said made sense; however, I didn't think that it was enough to doubt that girl.
"You think she's linked with Perdere?" I asked.
"Possibly. I'd have to look into it."
"Meh, no need to waste any time. Let's go and see her right now. We'll get the answers out of her."
Aelua's eyes widened. "Weren't you planning on searching for your friend? Why do you go see her right away… it'll just make things more complicated with her. She'll hide her true personality even more."
I looked at Aelua dead in the eyes. "Do you really think I give a shit? I'll make her tell me everything she knows. And if she's a demon, then we will simply gain some time in finding my friend since she will be able to guide us to their hidden lair."
With those words, Aelua didn't know what to say and just agreed to follow me.
I asked around a little in search of a certain Laura, and sure enough, we found our way to her room.
I gave a few knocks.
"Laura, it's me, Caedrel."
Instantly, the door was swung wide open. "Ah, you're here already! Perfect, come in, come in!"
She was smiling brightly as she grabbed my hand and pulled me right into her room. Then, her gaze switched toward Aelua, and her expression distorted.
"Ugh, you didn't come alone?"
She seemed disgusted as she uttered those words.
"No, Aelua wanted to come with me, so I didn't see anything wrong with it. Is that fine?"
Her expression returned to a smiling one right away as she said, "Of course! Of course! Come inside."
Then, we sat inside her room, and she even brought me some tea. However, she didn't bring any to Aelua, making it clear that she did not like her presence whatsoever.
"I have a question, actually, if I may?" I started off with.
"Of course, ask me anything!"
"Why are you such a big fan of me? As far as I know, those are the only articles that were released about me. There should not be any other information out there."
She looked flustered, blushing slightly. "Well, I just thought it was amazing how you announced their return to the world. It was amazing… and so dramatic! I loved it."
I activated my skills to see if she was telling the truth, and it seemed that she was. However, her response was… how to say? Very strange. She looked absolutely crazy in the head.
"Hm, glad you liked it. I hadn't actually planned it. It just sort of happened."
A slight cough came from my right, where Aelua was sitting, as she wanted me to speed things up from the looks of it.
"Anyway, I had some other questions if you would be interested in answering."
"Sure, go ahead. I already told you, but you can ask me anything!"
"Alright, I was curious about you. Aelua told me that you became a noble through your own achievements. I was interested in knowing how much time it took you to become a noble."
I knew of the timeline when demons had appeared in the world, so depending on her answer, it would tell me if she really was a demon.
"How much time did it take me to become a noble?"
"Yes."
"Ugh… it's been two years since I became one, and I'm twenty. You can do the math."
My eyes narrowed. She had just answered the question indirectly… and when people did that, my skill, which would tell me whether the person before me was telling the truth or not, would malfunction.
It was as if she knew of its existence.
"Hm… I'm not really good at math. Could you tell me the number?"
"Hahaha! Stop joking with me… since I was born; it took over 18 years for me to become an elven princess."
Her response came out as the truth, which was strange. However, since she had answered the question directly. There was little to no doubt she was really telling the truth.
"Hm… is that so? Then, I guess there's no point in the rest of my questions. Thank you for your time."
"Oh, are you sure that you can't stay a little longer? I want to learn all about you!"
"Hm… I got something to do. I might come back at another time."
Just as I was about to head out with Aelua, I felt her hand holding me in place. "Wait, can I ask you a favor since I answered your questions?"
"Uh… depends on what it is."
"Sure, I promise it's nothing too complicated." She smiled brightly. "I just want to have a spar against you… I want to see just how strong the person who discovered the demon's return truly is. What do you say?"
I looked over to Aelua, and she didn't seem to mind. In fact, she seemed to encourage it.
After all, if I fought against her, I would have even more opportunities to see if she really was a demon.
With those thoughts in mind, I accepted her offer. However, she told me that she needed to prepare a little bit for the fight, so she wanted to do it tomorrow, and I agreed.
***
Tomorrow quickly came as I arrived at the elven training grounds, and for some reason, there were a ton of people in the stands. It seemed the word had spread that I would be fighting against Laura Virdi…

chapters.title: Chapter 179 - 178 - Sparring (1)
chapters.content:
As I walked in, I immediately noticed a huge crowd, which was strange considering that our fight wasn't supposed to be anything grand.
I now perfectly understood the reason why the princess had asked to spar against me the following day. It seemed she wanted to have a lot of eyes on this fight, which was surprising if she were a demon since she could reveal her true self at any given moment.
That's why it made me think that she wasn't one. However, I still had my guard up. Even when she touched me back when I visited her. I had already tried to tell if she was a demon, but my skill kept failing on me. Making it impossible for me to tell her race.
In fact, that skill had started failing ever since I had used it on Zero. It seemed that there had been a strange reaction when I used it on him… making the skill malfunction.
It was annoying, but it wasn't like I could do anything about it for the moment.
"Uh… why is it that there are that many people?" I asked Laura, who looked over in my direction with an innocent smile.
"Ah. That. I just wanted to make sure that there would be as many people as possible to witness your greatness. Do you mind it?"
'I do,' I thought in the back of my mind as I kept a straight face.
"No, not at all. The more the merrier, am I right?"
"Exactly! I knew you would understand!"
Anyway, I didn't think that it would become such a big thing as I could even see the king was present to witness our fight. Aelua accompanied me here, and she was also here.
"Well, I don't have all day. So, how about we start this spar?" I asked with the same smile as earlier.
Since there were a lot of people, I wasn't planning on going all out whatsoever. It was a spar, and truthfully, I couldn't care less if I lost against Laura. After all, she was supposed to be a one of a kind talent. If I put up a good fight against her, I would already be deemed to have done well.
"Sure, but if you don't mind. Could we go over a few rules for our spar?"
I shrugged, telling her that I didn't care.
"Alright, so I thought of a few rules. The first one is that we can't use any killing moves toward our opponent. The second is that we can't use our race's special power, whether it be Mana or Mother Nature. That's about it; I only want the two of us to fight using our techniques since I would have no way to win against you if you did."
As she said those words, everyone within the crowd gasped, shocked.
"Did the princess just admit that she was weaker than him?"
"But how? No one ever heard of him until a few days ago!"
"Will the princess really lose against him? She's never lost a fight against anyone! That would be crazy!"
I heard a few murmurs from the crowd that proved my opponent's talent. Actually, I liked her rules. It made things easier for me. I didn't believe that she could defeat me with techniques alone, and it also made it easier for me not to use my powers.
I would have to let my sword do the talking.
"Are those rules fine with you?" Laura uttered, ignoring the comments from the crowd.
"Yeah, they seem good enough."
To be honest, I was only doing this as a favor since I had gone to see her yesterday and asked her a bunch of questions, which could be considered disrespectful. I thought it was only fair that I was here.
"So, can we start this fight?" I asked, now bored.
She nodded as she got in a fighting position, her knees slightly bending as she pulled out a dagger.
"Oh, are you an assassin?"
I was surprised. I hadn't expected such a thing. To be honest, assassins are always at a disadvantage in a one-on-one fight, so she was already in a bad position to win, and it hadn't even started.
I stayed in a neutral position as I pulled out my sword from my spacial pouch that was wrapped around my waist.
"I'll give you the first move."
She smirked. "How nice of you!"
Without wasting a single moment, she disappeared from my sight, reappearing at close range.
Her physical abilities were definitely decent since she had managed to move at such a speed without the help of mana. It was unfortunate for her, but it was nowhere close to being enough. I could see all of her movements perfectly. In fact, from my point of view, she was moving in slow motion.
Her dagger was aimed at my waist.
It was a smart move. Most would have aimed for my neck. It seemed she had a lot of experience when it came to fighting. It seemed what Aelua told me was true, she hadn't become a princess by a stroke of luck. She had worked for it.
Still, I deflected her strike without much difficulty. I also didn't try to counter attack. I was feeling nice today. I might have taught her a thing or two during this fight.
"Good idea. But you'll need more than that to beat me." I smiled. "Let's add a new rule to this fight. If you can land a single strike on me, you win. And if I last for more than… five minutes. I win. What do you say?"
I could see Laura clenching her jaw as she realized that I was much stronger than her when it came to pure fighting techniques and physical abilities.
"Fine."
The crowd was even more shocked this time as they heard Laura agree to such a humiliating rule.
"Just how strong is this unknown man that Laura would accept such a ridiculous proposition?!"
Even the king was flabbergasted… unsure how to react to such a rule. He couldn't believe that I was that much stronger than Laura.
"Actually, I'm feeling nice today. Make sure to look at me as I block your strikes. You might learn a thing or two."
I could feel that Laura was slowly burning up from the inside. She was clearly very angry, however, as I looked at her face. There was not a single sign that she might be a demon. Her eyes didn't change color like what had happened with Derek. The chances of her being a demon dropped even more.
Laura once more dashed in my direction; this time, she tried something different as she threw a throwing knife in my direction, which was perfect with her strike.
Still, it was still far from enough as I simply moved slightly to the right, dodging both her strikes with a single footstep.
"HOW?!"
"How did he dodge that so easily?!"
The fight continued, and the more I dodged her strikes or deflected them, the more I deflected them. The more the people within the crowd started to wonder about my identity.
After all, someone they had heard of for the very first time a few days ago was currently beating one of their most talented fighters without the slightest difficulty. In fact, I was even going as far as teaching her some moves while we fought.
Giving her some tips as the fight progressed.
"You shouldn't have attacked that way."
"You should tried a feint there."
"You should have blocked my sight before attacking."
With every strike she attempted, I kept giving her a tip.
I could only imagine how infuriating that would be in the long run. In fact, I could hear her mutter some curse words through her ragged breath. She was getting tired of attacking me, and I could even see it in her sluggish movements.
No matter what she tried, she couldn't touch me.
"One minute left!" Someone in the crowd exclaimed.
"Meh, let's break one of the rules you said earlier. I'll allow you to use whatever power you want against me. It might make things slightly challenging for me."
After all, this fight was getting boring to watch.
Laura gritted her teeth. "Do you like watching me humiliate myself that much?!" She shouted, her rage seeping into her voice.
A strong energy suddenly covered her body. It was of a bright green color, which was clearly a power that belonged to the elves.
'Hm… it's pretty much confirmed that she is an elf now.'
The reason I had pushed her to her limits was simple. I wanted definitive proof that she wasn't a demon. After all, that ominous energy that I had felt back in the throne room was definitely suspicious, followed by her appearance at Aelua's private room. There were a lot of weird things surrounding this girl.
But it seemed that I had been wrong about her.
"Come at me with everything you got," I smirked.

chapters.title: Chapter 180 - 179 - Sparring (2)
chapters.content:
From her previous attacks, I already knew that even if she used all her strength. Then, she wouldn't be able to leave a scratch on me. Well, unless she had been acting until, but it didn't seem that way, at least.
"Just how are you so powerful… you're just a human," she muttered under her breath.
I knew that elves were somewhat "racist" toward other races, especially humans since we were deemed as the least powerful. After all, humans were special. We had access to an energy that had the "potential" to become much stronger than all the other races.
However, the amount of people who reached such a stage was limited. It was different from the elves, who could simply call upon Mother Nature to help them fight. It was hard to nurture such a power. That's why they spent most of their time training their sword and bow techniques.
"Why aren't you calling upon Mother Nature?" I smirked. "I told you to use everything at your disposition."
She shook her head. "I don't need her to make you bleed!"
"Are you sure about that? You haven't even managed to make me sweat for the time being."
The reason why I wanted to see her summon Mother Nature was because I knew that it was impossible for a demon to do so. Mother Nature despised demons, and that was also one of the reasons why I could also call upon her; she knew of my hatred of them and desired to help me in my harsh path.
But since she was refusing to do so, I thought it was weird. She should know better than anyone that she could not beat me if things stayed this way.
"Don't mock me in front of my kind!" She continued to shout.
She launched another attack.
I gracefully blocked it without any problems.
"There's only thirty seconds left, either summon Mother Nature or lose."
She clenched her jaw. "I didn't want to use this against you, but I guess I have no choice."
Laura closed her eyes as I felt a lot of energy starting to form all around her body. She was clearly calling for Mother Nature, or at least, that's what I had thought.
Suddenly, her eyes opened wide, and she disappeared from my field of view. However, it wasn't like before. I truly couldn't see her. She wasn't in slow motion before me, trying to attack me. I could not see her.
Then, I felt the cold feeling of a sword pressing against my neck.
She had managed to break through my defenses, and the worst thing about all this was that I ignored how she had done it. She hadn't even called upon Mother Nature. She had just summoned a strange internal energy.
"See? I told you I didn't her. I, alone, am enough to kill you," she whispered in my ears, her sword slightly brushing against my neck, a little blood dripping onto her sword.
The crowd started cheering as soon as they noticed that she had managed to beat me.
"Laura!"
"Laura!"
"Laura!"
However, while I could hear her name inside the arena, I couldn't help but frown.
I didn't understand how she had gotten behind me. I had no idea. I needed to find out what she did.
Ignoring my surroundings, I analyzed her movements from the moment she closed her eyes to the moment she had her sword against my neck. If we had been in a real fight, I would also most likely have died to her sword… even if I had used all of my powers, I wouldn't have been able to block this sword. I was certain of it.
I turned toward Laura, who strangely still had her sword against my neck.
"You. How did you do that at the end? What energy did you use to move so fast that even I lost sight of your movements?"
"Secret… you'll have to figure it out on your own. Otherwise, you might die if we were to fight again," she said with a knowing smirk.
Those comments of hers were definitely strange. She kept talking as if she wanted to kill me right now… or maybe she wanted to show me that she could kill me at any moment she wished.
"Hm. A secret…"
"Yeah, aren't you the master of secrets? Your whole existence is shrouded in mystery," she replied with the same annoying smirk as before.
She looked as if she knew everything about me, which made no sense, considering that she said she had learned of me with those articles. She was hiding something. I just knew it. I was sure of it.
"You. Just who are you?" I asked as the crowd continued to cheer, unable to hear this little conversation between the two of us.
"I told you that much already, I'm Laura Virdi."
"No, I'm not talking about that. Who are you really? Just what are you hiding behind that innocent smile of yours."
She shrugged. "I think you're starting to hallucinate. You should get some sleep, I'm just a perfectly normal elven princess."
With those words, she looked away and bowed toward the crowd as a way to thank everyone who had come here.
***
POV Laura
Thirty minutes after the sparring ended.
"Huh…I wanted to kill him so bad. If only Father had allowed it…" I clenched my teeth and my fists. "AHH! I would cut off his head in front of all the elves, and I would have shown everyone that Caedrel Stuart was nothing. Someone that I could with the flick of my pinky."
I tried to calm down by going to kill off a few humans I had captured a while ago. But killing them didn't change my mood at all. I still remember the feeling of having my sword against his neck. With a single movement, I could have ended his life.
However, the words of my father still resounded in my mind. "Don't touch Caedrel Stuart, no matter what you do. He is too dangerous. If we kill him, then someone much more dangerous than him will appear, and he's not someone that any of you can deal with."
I just didn't understand those words… why would my father be afraid of him or that hidden person that I had never heard of in my entire life?
I could have killed him just now. All of our worries would have vanished, and no one would have been able to stop us, no matter what they did. My father, the demon king, didn't even say anything when I asked why. He only said that it would be best if we let Caedrel Stuart alone.
Maybe he had a plan for him… maybe he wanted to recruit him. I had no clue. However, for some reason, he didn't want us to take revenge for our brother's death.
It was true that we were close to taking over the elven territory as my father had finally gotten in contact with the king.
