If we were to get an ally such as the elves, then the war would practically be won. We would no longer need to hide everywhere, and we would be able to use this place as our base. After all, out of all the races, the elves are the most corrupt.
The king doesn't care about the other noble families. He doesn't even care that a lot of elves are being captured and sold off as slaves.
It makes me laugh that the elven king has this mentality and still acts as if he's better than everyone. He has no beliefs, he's a fucking loser who only has influence.
At least, I respect Caedrel since he can actually fight himself, and he doesn't rely on others to do what he wants to do. He has his beliefs, and he will do everything in his power to respect them. That's one thing that I can respect about him.
Still, he's a dick, and all he deserves is to die.
Honestly, the fact that he pushed me far enough to use that energy says a lot about his strength. He is probably one of, if not the strongest, human that is still alive to this day.
"Ugh… just who is his backer, though, and why did Father seem so scared of him as if he could kill us all if that individual just desired it."
I shook my head at those thoughts. There was no use in thinking about it any further. The orders were simple. Act just as you were before, and do not cause problems.
'Still, I heard that we captured the girl with who he had been traveling. Caedrel will definitely go looking for her… he's not one to abandon his friends like that.'
Then, just as I was about to head out of my room, there was a man before my door.
It wasn't someone that I had been expecting. It was the Elven King.
"We have to talk."

chapters.title: Chapter 181 - 180 - The Elven King (1)
chapters.content:
I kept thinking back on what happened in the spar against Laura Virdi. Her last attack.
Even now, I was at a loss for how she had managed to do such a thing. Hell, I didn't even know of the power she had utilized to move so fast… the speed at which she moved was similar to the one of the small monster who had been keeping an eye on us in the Snowy Mountains.
Hank had been able to keep an eye on it while I was at a complete loss when it came to it.
'Maybe it could be related to aether?'
That was the only idea that I had in mind. I knew that elves were naturally more agile because of their connection with Earth, but that's where it stopped. Both Aelua and I ignored the existence of an elf that could move so fast.
In fact, even Aelua, who had been watching from the sidelines, knew what had happened during that fight. She was at a complete loss for words.
I thought she might have been able to help me, considering that she was watching from another point of view. But she was even more lost than me when it came to this.
"Have you ever seen that princess call upon Mother Nature?" I asked Aelua, who just shrugged.
She had told me beforehand, but she really didn't pay attention to anything when it came to the elven territory. She ignored just as many things as me, and I had just arrived. She was truly a scientist whose only purpose was to keep making tests all day long.
"Hm… maybe I should ask her directly. She should be able to tell me about her, right?" I asked.
I wasn't actually sure if Mother Nature remembered the times that she was summoned with others. However, I hoped she did. I knew that she remembered me since every time I would call upon her, she would recognize me.
"I don't know. You can try, but she only remembers about a few of us. The ones she is interested in are the ones she remembers; as for the rest, she barely even recalls what she did."
I nodded. "Well, if someone with Laura's talent were to call upon her, then she should be interested in her. At least, I hope so."
With that thought, I closed my eyes as I called upon the power of the elves, Aelua shaking her head as she watched me.
"I still think that it's completely ridiculous that you can do such a thing. Using powers that should be only limited to specific races is out of this world. You really are lucky to have such a gift."
I smirked. I knew that I was lucky to have that power. However, it wasn't like I hadn't worked for it. It was a result of my effort in the long run. And it was certainly deserved.
Then, just as Aelua was about to continue, Mother Nature appeared before us with the same alluring appearance as always.
"Caedrel? Why are you calling me when there aren't any dangers nearby?" Mother's Nature snapped when she noticed that Aelua was also present in the room. "Um… are you in the elven territory right now? How come you're here?"
"I needed help from her. Though that isn't why I wanted to see you. Actually, it's not even about me. I wanted to ask about another elf that you may or may not know about, a certain Laura Virdi. Ever heard of her?"
"Laura Virdi?" She asked, floating before me. "No… I don't think I know anyone by that name. Why are you asking?"
"We think that there's a chance she's a demon hiding within the elven territory. Actually, not only that, I think there's a chance that she might be one of the Demon King's daughters."
The atmosphere instantly changed, becoming a lot more serious. Mother Nature's also became a lot more intense as I could feel it reaching every corner of the room.
"Why do you think about that?" She took a pause. "Be careful what you say. You are talking about an elf. You know that I like you a lot. However, I won't accept any disrespect when it comes to the elves."
It was the first time that I had seen Mother Nature turn so serious with me, and it was definitely different from her usual way of doing things.
"Calm down. I'm not saying this for no reason. I have doubts, and I need answers."
"Why is that? What did she do against you?" She frowned. "How would the daughter of the Demon King even manage to pass on as an elf? This makes no sense, Caedrel. I hope you have a good explanation."
"I do. When I killed Zero, one of the sons of the Demon King, he told me that his siblings were hidden in all the races without anyone being able to detect them at all. High officials that no one has ever seen before that are hidden within the races as spies to get connections."
"And what did this Laura do?" She asked right away.
"During the spar I did with her, she managed to beat me. However, I have no idea how she did it."
Mother Nature closed her mouth for a moment. She couldn't believe what she had just heard coming out of my mouth. "She beat you? How? Were you using all of your strength?"
She found it hard to believe that an elf she had never heard of before had managed to beat me. It made no sense to her, especially since she knew very well about the extent of my strength. It wasn't just anyone who could beat me.
"I said that she would win if she landed a strike on me. In the beginning, I had managed to hold her off without any struggle. However, I allowed her to use whatever power she wanted, and that's when everything turned for the worse.
She moved so fast that I had lost sight of her, and the next thing, I had a sword pressed against my neck. I'm saying this seriously. Even if I had used all the powers at my disposition, I wouldn't have been able to stop her. If she had wanted to, she could have killed me right there without a doubt. She has the strength to kill me… and you don't even know who she is. Don't you see how strange this is?"
Mother Nature stopped talking as she stopped flying and sat on the nearest bed, thinking for one long minute about everything that I had just said.
"You're not lying, right? All of this truly happened?"
"That's right, that's really what happened."
"And she did all that without calling upon me?"
"Yes."
It seemed she was slowly realizing just how strange this whole situation was in the first place.
"Hm, if you bring me to her, I'll be able to tell you if she really is an elf," she finally said, thinking long and hard about it.
I had managed to convince her to think that someone had taken on the appearance of a demon.
"I really hope you're wrong about this. What do you think about this, Aelua?" Mother Nature asked, turning toward the silent alchemist.
"I don't know. There's definitely something strange about her. Her strength was unlike anything I've seen with someone as young as her. I did hear that she was a prodigy. But the fact that she didn't call upon you to defeat Caedrel is definitely strange, and in my opinion, it shouldn't be possible in the first place."
Mother Nature nodded quietly. "Then, let's go. I have to see her to tell you if she is truly an elf or someone who is disguised as one."
"I just want to warn you before we go there. There is a chance that she has taken over the body of an elf. Don't go off into a rampage right away. If you find out that she is really a demon, don't react. Wait until we leave and tell me then. She is strong, and fighting her without a plan could be very dangerous."
I remembered the words Zero had told me. That his siblings were a lot stronger than him. That's what he had said, and I had detected that he had been telling the truth.
There was also the fact that I had only been able to hurt Zero with some Aether mixed in my power. Even when I had tortured him at the end, I had to use aether to make him feel pain. Otherwise, it was as if he was unkillable.
That's why fighting Laura right now wasn't smart when I couldn't even control Aether decently.
"Don't worry, I won't do anything stupid. Now, let's go; what you see made me intrigued by the person who defeated you."
With those words, we left Aelua's room and ended straight to Laura's.
However, when we arrived, there were two guards in front of her door.
Aelua recognized them instantly. They were the King's personal guards.
What was the King doing in Laura's room right after our spar? Something was definitely strange here.

chapters.title: Chapter 182 - 181 - The Elven King (2)
chapters.content:
"Hey, let us through. I need to talk with Laura about my spar," I said to both guards, who stared me down as if I was some kind of criminal who deserved a beating.
"I'm sorry, but that's not possible at the moment. Please wait until the King is done."
Aelua, who had as much importance as the King in the elven kingdom, stepped forward.
"Let us through. Don't make me repeat myself."
The tone of her voice was booming with intensity and killing intent.
Both Royal Guards felt it. However, they were still unmoved; they stayed in front of the door, a sword hanging around their waist.
"I'm sorry, miss. But the King has told us not to let anyone inside, no matter who it might be," one of the guards answered, trying to be as polite as possible.
They knew that they could not deal with both Aelua and me. They knew that they couldn't even come close to the strength I had displayed at the sparring earlier. That's why they were acting like good little puppies.
Still, I had to admit that they were very loyal to the King. Refusing us access to the room wasn't something that I had expected. Nevertheless, I just shrugged.
"If that's what you two want," I muttered as I cracked my knuckles and walked very slowly in their direction, knocking the two of them unconscious.
I knew that they were only following orders, which is why I did not try to hurt them. I simply wanted to get through.
As I knocked them unconscious, I also made sure that they didn't make the slightest noise since I didn't want the King and Laura to hear that there was someone on the other side of the door.
They had probably heard us already because of our conversation with the guards, but there was still a slight chance that we would be able to listen in on them.
Taking care of both guards, I indicated to Aelua that I wanted to listen in on their private conversation without the King knowing. After all, there was a chance that very important information was being told on the other side of the door.
As I placed my ear against the door, I could hear some murmurs on the other side of the door. It seemed that they had not taken care of the noise we had made on the outside.
I couldn't grasp all the words coming out of their mouth. However, I did catch up on a few words. Aelua, who was also doing the same thing as me, seemed to be in a similar situation as the look on her face kept changing slightly as their conversation progressed.
"…deal with…accepted…three days from now…start."
That's all I had managed to grasp in the short time that I had been listening to their conversation. The voice also seemed to be that of the King, as it was not very feminine.
"…good."
'Some kind of deal?' I thought back on the words the King had uttered. I couldn't help but think about what kind of deal he would have made and why he needed to talk with Laura, who wasn't even a born noble.
Why would the King of the kingdom come all the way here to talk about such things? They should not even be close at all. Maybe they were, but even then it would be strange for the King to come all the way here to tell her about it. There was definitely something strange about it, and I was tired of playing a guessing game.
With that thought, I walked right into the room, opening the wooden door widely.
And what I saw shocked me.
The Elven King was on his knees before Laura, one of her feet pressing down his face as if he were nothing more than a slave to her.
"You…what the hell is happening here?" Aelua immediately muttered. "What the hell are you doing, you fucking pawn of a king."
I couldn't even place a word as Aelua started unloading insult after insult, not even taking the slightest breath. She was disgusted. I could see it from the look on her face.
"A-Aelua? Caedrel? What are you two doing here? M-Mother Nature…?" The King's eyes widened as he saw such a thing.
He had no idea what was happening, but he knew that he wasn't in the best of situations.
Whatever this was… he knew that his reputation was bound to take a hit since we had seen such a thing.
"Caedrel. I know you told me not to do anything stupid, but… this… this…" Mother Nature was doing her best not to say anything for the moment. However, I could already tell by the tone of her voice.
That girl, Laura Virdi, wasn't an elf.
Otherwise, Mother Nature wouldn't have acted in such a way. And as much as I wanted to get rid of her right now. I could not.
I wasn't strong enough just yet to deal with her. My aether mastery wasn't high enough, no matter what I tried to do. I was lacking in that department, and she was the same as her brother. Then, I wouldn't be able to deal with her no matter what I tried to pull off.
She was also stronger than him, and I wasn't confident enough in defeating her. I was lacking right now. I needed to get stronger. That's why, after handing the Black Heart to Aelua, I had been planning on training; well, that was before Amelia was captured by demons.
Things were just getting worse and worse, and I didn't know what to do.
'Should I ask help from the master? He would be able to put an end to this war if I asked for his help.'
However, while I had this thought. I knew that it wasn't a good idea to involve my master in this war. I knew what he was capable of, and things would only get worse for the entire world if he got involved. He was just that powerful.
"Oh my… why are you two coming to see me right away? Caedrel, are you that mad that I defeated you back there?" Laura said with a bright smile, confident that I would not try anything on her just yet. "The King just wanted to bow down to me because of my strength. That's all. You two can leave now."
She continued to smile at us. She knew that I wouldn't do anything for some reason. She was convinced about it, which was strange.
"Aldin, what do you have to say for yourself? If she telling the truth, did you really get in that position willingly?" Aelua asked right away.
"I-I did!" He answered without any hesitation. Fear mingled in with the tone of his voice.
He was scared of Laura, who was now confirmed to be one of the daughters of the Demon King.
I just learned about the identity of another child of the Demon King, and I couldn't do anything about her. It was frustrating, but it was for the better.
Still, there was one thing that worried me right now, the deal.
I had heard of a deal, which meant that there was a deal that happened between the demons and the Elven King. And the most dangerous thing about it was that it ignored what the purpose of that deal was. I needed to get more information about it, but I couldn't really ask right now. I needed to keep it a secret that I knew while I observed everything that happened in the following days. After all, it started three days ago.
That's what the King had said.
This means that three days from now, something major was bound to happen within the Elven Territory, and I would make sure to be there to witness it.
"I see. Then there is no need for us to stay here any longer," I said, furious as I felt the gazes of both Aelua and Mother Nature on me.
With that said, I turned around and left them alone. I couldn't do anything to stop her. Not yet.
My lack of power was showing once again, and I needed to work on it once more. I simply had no choice at this point in time.
Leaving the room with both Aelua and Mother Nature, the two of them were furious as they immediately bombarded me with questions.
"Why didn't you do anything?! Couldn't you see that she was one of them?" Aelua said right away.
"She's not an elf, Caedrel. We need to deal with her as fast as possible."
"We can't," I said, cutting both of them off. "Not yet, at least. I lack strength. You two ignore this, but the only way to hurt the children of the Demon King is through the use of Aether. Without it, we have no chance of winning, and I have only begun to master it."
"We can't do anything to her yet. However, we will have to keep our eyes open for three days from now. They were talking about a deal earlier… probably something related to the demons. There is a chance that the Elven King has betrayed humanity."

chapters.title: Chapter 183 - 182 - Someone Who Was Thought Dead (1)
chapters.content:
And just like that, three days passed by in a flash.
Ever since that day, I had not seen Laura or the King, and neither did Aelua. No matter where I tried to look for them, it was impossible to find them. It was frustrating because I had no idea what would be happening that day, and I could not stop it.
All I knew was that there was a deal that was made between the elves and the demons.
For the past three days, I had not done much. I had stayed with Aelua for the most part, showing her what Aether was and how it worked. I also explained to her where it came from.
She had obviously never heard of such an energy, and she was clearly confused at first. But when I told her that this was the only energy that could hurt the children of the Demon King, the whole atmosphere had changed.
To be honest, the only reason I decided to tell Aelua about my skills was actually quite simple. I knew that with her skills, she would have ideas to help me progress in the use of Aether. With her knowledge of alchemy, I knew that she must have seen something similar to this energy in the past.
And who knows? I thought that she would be able to find a way to increase my damage output using Aether.
So, that's what we have done for the past three days, trying to find a way to make my damage output much higher than it was in the past.
However, we still hadn't found anything. But we were getting closer with each passing day. It was just that today… well, there was this deal.
"Do you really think that we will learn of what the deal consisted of?" Aelua muttered. "I don't think the Demon King would be stupid enough to make it so painfully obvious."
"Who cares? The moment that stupid king of yours is alone, I'll torture him until he tells us everything that we need."
Aelua didn't say anything as she agreed with my actions, even if she thought that they were somewhat harsh and violent. Still, she knew that it was necessary. If the Elven King, Aldin, had truly betrayed them, then the only thing he deserved was death.
"Do you really think that he formed an alliance on behalf of the elven territory?" Aelua couldn't help but ask.
"We'll find out today."
That was the only kind of "deal" that I had been able to think of over the past few days. Nothing else seemed to make sense in my mind. After all, there hadn't been any weird movements from within the territory apart from Laura and the King. The rest of the population hadn't even noticed anything, which made me think that there wasn't some kind of hidden attack being launched against another territory.
Also, taking such a drastic approach to the war would make things awkward for the demons when they have the advantage right now. The advantage of being able to blend in and take any appearance they desire.
It was a dangerous ability that had fooled the whole world for more than seven years…
A whole seven years… that was the time the Demon King had to think about his strategy in how he would conquer the world. There was no doubt that his plan would be much better than mine, which basically consisted of fighting head-on against anyone I would meet. However, ever since I had lost in that spar, I knew that it was no longer a solution to winning this war.
There were two things that I had thought of doing over the past three days.
The first one was asking for help from the Gods so that we would also have Divinity behind us. However, I only knew a single human who could contact Gods, and for all I knew, she could be dead, as I had not heard of her for more than three years.
The second one was to break the curse from the Ancient Tribe.
I still remember the gaze in Zale's eyes as he told me that he believed I could free them.
However, there was only one small problem with the second option. I had literally no idea how to break that curse. I didn't even know how to see curses… that's why the first option was certainly the better choice. Though, I was still stuck at the very step since I had no clue where I could find her.
Still, I knew where I could find hints of her whereabouts.
Anyway, those thoughts were useless until I managed to find Amelia again. I didn't want to leave her with the demons, even if I believed that they wouldn't be stupid enough to try anything on her.
"Let's go," I suddenly said, dismissing my thoughts. "It's time to figure out what kind of deal those two bastards made."
As I said that, I headed out of the room as a letter fell down from the door right this instant.
'Hm… who put this there?' I thought.
After all, ever since I had learned of Laura's true identity, I had always been on guard, spreading my senses to the limit. However, the fact that there was a letter in front of my door could only mean one thing, someone had managed to fool my senses…
"What does it say?" Aelua asked right away as she was dying to take that letter away from my hands.
Anyway, I opened it and started reading its content, making sure to pay attention to every single word that was written. But… because of how short the message was, it didn't take me long to comprehend the message.
[I hope you're ready for what's to come. Come to the throne room. :)]
"That bitch." Aelua clenched her fists just thinking of her. "Who the fuck does she think she is."
"There's no need to get mad over this. That's exactly what she wants from us. It doesn't matter anyway; she knows that we can't stop her; otherwise, we would have already done it."
Aelua shook her head. "I still don't know why I didn't ask for help from the human kingdom. They would have helped prepare against whatever is happening today."
"Whatever, let's go to the throne. The king will finally make an announcement there. At least, that's my guess."
It took a little over five minutes, but we managed to find our way to the throne room after some time.
There, almost all the nobles that I had seen when I had first arrived were present as they were glaring in the direction of the throne where three people could be seen.
Laura, the Elven King, and someone wearing a strange mask that closely resembled the one of Zero.
It was only a guess, but I could feel an ominous energy from the masked person. I had a strong feeling that he was another one of the Demon King's children.
'Just how much did this guy even fuck that he has so many kids?' I thought.
It was honestly ridiculous how many children he had around this age. However, what was even crazier was the fact that they were all so powerful for no reason.
My thoughts were cut short as the Elven King stood up slightly from his throne with a bright smile.
The murmurs from the nobles died down right this instant as everyone bowed out of respect. Well, apart from both Aelua and me, who took this opportunity to stare down the traitor that was before us,
There was no longer any doubt in both of our minds. This man had betrayed us and had decided to side with the demons.
'He probably thought that it was the right decision for his people in the long run…' I thought.
Actually, I knew that was what had gone through his mind. There were two reasons why anyone would side with the demons.
Survival.
Power.
Those were the two things that could make someone side with them.
Other than that, there was literally no reason to do so.
"You may rise," Aldin muttered as he moved his hands upwards, indicating that everyone should rise.
"Everyone of you must be wondering why I called you here. Well, the reason is quite simple, I have a grand announcement to make."
'The Demon King wouldn't be stupid enough to announce to the world that the elves have betrayed the world, right?'
Because if the elven king was really about to say what I thought he was about to say. Then, this was one of, if not the dumbest strategy that I had ever seen in my life… telling everyone who betrayed them to talk about being stupid.
Still, I was just assuming things, so I continued to listen to what the Elven King had to say to me.
"You must have noticed that I am next to Laura Virdi, the woman who managed to defeat Caedrel Stuart, the man who discovered the return of demons in spar. However, every one of you must be wondering who is hiding behind this hood, right?"
The Elven King smirked in my direction, as did Laura, as they talked about the masked man.
"I am here to announce to all of you something that will greatly increase our military forces," Aldin said as he pulled off the mask from the person.
And what was revealed was unlike anything that I had imagined.
It was Zero, standing right there… on the stage for everyone to see.
However, there was something strange. It didn't feel as if he was there… the look on his face was unchanging, and the life in his eyes also seemed nonexistent.

chapters.title: Chapter 184 - 183 - Someone Who Was Thought Dead (2)
chapters.content:
His eyes were hollow and passive.
It was strange. I wasn't sure how to describe it, but it was as if Zero was there but wasn't actually 'there.' It looked as if he was devoid of a conscience, which would make a lot of sense considering I had killed him.
I had seen his head rolling on the ground. So, for him to stand before me meant that something was wrong. Either they had managed to bring him back to life with the help of some unknown power, or the person on the stage wasn't the Zero that I had killed.
"This is a new experiment that I have been working on with Miss Virdi. We have decided to call it a Super Soldier."
'Super Soldier?'
I frowned at those words. I had a vague idea of where they were heading with this, and I didn't like its sound.
In fact, I despised it.
"Those Super Soldier just like this man right here," the Elven King said as he started walking around Zero. "Will listen to everything we order them to do, no matter what. They don't have a conscience of their own."
It was just like I had guessed.
"Let me demonstrate."
The Elven King smiled widely and proudly as his chest was bumped up. "I want you to get on your knees and act like a dog."
Zero's expression did not change even remotely as he immediately got on his knees and started barking like a dog, just like the king had ordered him.
As he did so, my eyes instinctively found their way toward Laura, who I imagined to be fuming. After all, this was her brother… and he was acting like a dog in front of all of the nobles. It was humiliating.
However, she didn't have the slightest reaction as she kept looking back into my eyes while all of this was going on.
"The fact that they will listen to everything we say, however, isn't that great. What's even better is their resistance to pain. No matter the pain inflicted on them, they will never flinch."
As the king uttered those words, he pulled out a long sword from his waist and swiftly cut one of Zero's arms.
Everyone's eyes widened, shocked by the actions the king was taking.
However, just like he had advertised, Zero did not flinch, nor did he have any reaction.
"And you know the best part about all this?" The Elven King turned around with a smirk. "Well, I'll just let you watch."
Seconds passed by, and suddenly, right around the fresh cut, the blood coagulated, and Zero's arm was slowly regenerating on its own. And within one minute, it looked as if he had never lost it in the first place.
'They cannot feel pain, they can regenerate limbs… what about their fighting skills?'
That was the last question on my mind. If those Super Soldiers were able to keep a mind for themselves while fighting, then they would be a lot more dangerous than the demonic monsters that I had met over the past months.
"The best thing about the Super Soldiers is that they will keep their skills from when they died. Because, yes, I had not mentioned it. But Super Soldiers are essentially dead. All Laura and I have done is give them a second chance at 'life.'"
I clenched my teeth. If what Aldin had just revealed was true, then those Super Soldiers would be a lot more troublesome than I had anticipated. If things were as he had said, then I was in danger.
There was no doubt that Laura would try to kill me soon. And if she had the help of her brother, whom I only managed to defeat with the help of Hank, I would certainly die.
"This person you see on the stage was a very powerful being prior to their death, which is why he is the first Super Soldier that we have created. I wanted to show all of you the potential of the Super Soldiers. If we are able to make thousands, then we, the elves, will become unstoppable."
He was right. The longer this plan would go on, the more at a disadvantage we would find ourselves.
I wouldn't be able to do this alone any longer. I needed help from as many people as possible. There was only one problem, everyone that I was close with from the war was now living their lives away from the battlefield or any kind of drama.
I also had little means of contacting them.
To summarize everything, I was basically fucked if they actually managed to mass-produce Super Soldiers.
However, the limelight of all this was the fact Super Soldiers seemed to be Undead, and I knew of the perfect person to deal with the undead. I only needed to find her, the person who could talk with the Gods. Someone who had disappeared three years ago from the face of the Earth.
"Zero, please demonstrate one of your skills," Aldin uttered, his voice echoing through the crowd.
'Seems like they have decided to call him Zero even now,' I shook my head. 'I should have probably revealed some information about his identity back when I exposed the return of the demons. I thought I had gotten rid of him, but it seems he's still a pain in the ass.'
Suddenly, the sky turned dark, and the lively atmosphere of the forest was gone as darkness reigned over for a few moments. A strong purple light was also emitted from Zero's hands at this very moment.
'Aether?' I frowned. 'Just what is this skill… and why didn't he use it against me?'
I was at a loss for words as I continued to observe what was happening.
Then, as Zero had both of his hands in a fist, he opened them wide, lightning striking down from the sky in the middle of the crowd.
Because of my abilities, I could see lightning, and it would hit most of the nobles if nothing was done. And it also seemed like Laura wasn't planning on doing to stop such an attack.
I clenched my teeth. 'Should I stop it… After all, the elves have betrayed humanity.'
However, that's when I realized that my thinking was wrong.
The elves had not betrayed humanity. The king had. It was very different, and it was important to see the difference between the two.
With this in mind, I flew from my original spot toward the lightning that would reach the elves in less than a microsecond. Many of them would die if I didn't arrive in time.
I cast as many protective layers onto my body and calculated the trajectory of the lightning so that I could tank it with my body. I knew that this might be a ploy from Laura or the king, but I did not care… I didn't believe that she would try to kill me right now. She had had the opportunity to do so two times now, and she had not done it.
There was something that was restricting her from doing it. As for what that was, I had no idea.
Nevertheless, casting a layer of protective magic onto my body, I got in the way of the lightning strike, tanking it with my bare body.
-Bzzzt!
As soon as it hit, I could feel my mind going numb as I could barely keep them open. The only thing that I could feel at the moment was a burning sensation in my chest.
This lightning strike wasn't a normal one, that bastard… he had mixed a lot of Aether within it.
If I had not done anything, almost every noble would have died.
'Did Aldin really abandon his people to such a degree?' I asked myself as I could feel my mind getting lighter and lighter. 'He didn't side with the demons for his people's survival but for his own greed?'
I didn't know what to think anymore… in fact, I could barely even think.
And then, within a few seconds, I lost consciousness.
***
"Ugh… where am I?"
My mind felt heavy and strained.
I tried to raise my back, but I could not; my chest, especially the area around my heart, felt heavy. As I looked at it, my chest was not of my usual color. It was black, and my skin was charred.
"Don't try to move, Caedrel. You'll only make things worse," a distinct voice exclaimed right beside me.
"Argh… what are you talking about. It's only a lightning strike; I'm fine."
"It wasn't only a lightning strike, idiot. It was special. It was unlike any lightning strike that I had ever witnessed. And if you hadn't done anything to stop it, then most elves would have died right there."
That was the thing that confused me the most. Why would Aldin attack his very own people? No matter how hard I tried to think of it? There was no logic to his actions.
"Aelua, can you please tell me what happened after I lost consciousness?"

chapters.title: Chapter 185 - 184 - Evangeline Ashworth (1)
chapters.content:
"What happened after you lost consciousness?" Aelua repeated the question with a slight frown on her face, unsure what to say at this very moment.
"Well, nothing much. I came to your rescue, and the king simply apologized for what had just happened with the Super Soldier. He told everyone that it was a mistake and that it would never happen again."
Lying down in the bed, I nodded. It seemed his announcement had ended shortly after I had tanked the Aether-infused lightning strike.
"I see. Did Aldin or Laura try anything when I lost my consciousness?"
"No. They acted very thankful for the actions you had taken since you had just saved a lot of the nobles. Most people within the elven territory now see you in a good light."
"And what do you think about the Super Soldier? Did you notice anything strange?"
I was almost sure that Zero had been turned into an Undead. However, I wanted to get Aelua's opinion on the matter since she was the most knowledgeable when it comes to those subjects.
"Hm. My guess is that they used a strange spell that brought Zero back to 'life'. He isn't able to think anymore. However, he still retained his powers. What Aldin said was true. As long as they are able to make more of these Soldiers, then no one in the entire universe would be able to deal with them."
"I thought that he was an Undead. What do you think?"
"Um. Maybe. There's a chance that would be the case, however, I'm not well versed enough in the subject to guarantee that to you." Aelua already knew where I was going with this as she added, "You're not thinking of trying to find 'her', right?"
I shrugged. "I don't really have a choice, do I? She's the strongest person I know and when it comes to undeads. And if we wait some more time, then it'll reach a situation where we won't be able to do anything. I don't know how much time I have, so we need to move fast."
"Meh… she disappeared. No one has even heard of her in the past three years. Do you really think you'll be able to find her?"
"Probably. And if I don't, then we will lose the war against the demons. I can't deal with Undeads. We just need to hope that whatever spell they are using to make those Super Soldiers is costly and they can't mass-produce Undeads like Zero. If they can, then this is already a lost cause. If they turn some of the most powerful humans who died into Undeads, then there will be nothing that we can do."
"When are you planning to leave?" Aelua asked.
I could see the worry in her eyes. After all, it wouldn't be an easy task to find her… some people said she had left on a pilgrimage. Others said she was dead. Others said she had left for the realm of Gods.
There were tons of rumors about her. However, I didn't believe she had died or left for some other realm. She was definitely still in this world, she was just hiding.
"Right now. I'm leaving right now for the God's Temple. They should have a better idea of where she left."
That was my first destination, a kingdom for believers. I had heard of it three years ago before she had disappeared. Her last words were that she was heading there to get a deeper connection with the God she believed in.
That's around the same time that rumors about her disappearance started to spread around the world.
"Right now? But you're still hurt… and what about your friend that was captured by the demons? Weren't you going to save her right away…"
Aelua was shocked, as her eyelids kept fluttering. Her arms even started trembling slightly.
"I want to help her, but this comes first. If things really develop like Aldin announced, then this could very well result in the end of the world. While I care about Amelia very much, I have my priorities. Also, I'm sure she's fine, she's not the kind to be broken so easily… and I don't believe that the demons would be stupid enough to touch an hair on her body. Otherwise, they would have to face my hatred… and since Laura didn't try anything against me even when I lost consciousness. I have a feeling that they have an order to not hurt me, or at the very least, not to kill me."
That was the conclusion I had come to with the recent events. The amount of times Laura could have killed me were in the dozens, and still, nothing happened. I had also noticed that she wanted to get her revenge. I had killed her brother, after all.
However, even then, the worse she had done was having a sword against my throat and making me bleed slightly when she could have killed me.
The Demon King was scared of me… However, I had a feeling that it wasn't actually me but someone who I had once been close to, my master.
I could certainly understand why he would be scared since I was also scared of that man. Even if I believed he would never hurt me, if things went wrong, then things could become… weird for the world. Let's put it at that.
My master.
It had been over five years since he had disappeared out of nowhere, leaving only a simple note behind.
'Your training is now over. Have fun and don't become a monster like me. Keep smiling through the pain.'
I could still remember vividly the content of that note. The day where I was left all alone and where I began to conquer the battlefield by myself, shocking everyone, my foes and comrades.
***
It had been a week since I had left the Elven Territory.
I had finally reached the desert. It was unending. No matter where I looked, all I could see was sand going on for thousands of kilometers. The sheer size of the desert would make it very hard to find my friend. She could be literally anywhere in here. I just hoped that she wasn't anywhere that could not be seen with the naked eye.
From where I was standing, I could already see a huge temple not too far away from where I was standing. Maybe a few kilometers away.
It was actually a small city in the desert where devotees for the God of the Sun gathered. The very same god who my friend was devoted to.
"Let's go, Aelua."
She had insisted on coming with me. And I had wanted to refuse at first, but I had accepted at the end. However, she was struggling to follow me because of how fast I was traveling.
"W-Wait…" Her breathing was rugged and rough. "Can't we just take a five-minute break? Please…"
"I told you already. I can take you in my arms, or you can walk. I am not waiting for you."
She clicked her tongue as she pushed herself up, staggering as she got on her feet, almost falling down right away.
"Are you that you're okay to continue?"
I knew that she was in a very bad shape. However, I couldn't waste time taking care of her, which is why I was pushing her to her very limits. I knew that it was not a nice thing to do. But it wasn't my fault that she had followed me all the way here.
"I-It's fine…" she muttered as she staggered forward, one of her hands landing on my shoulder.
Seeing her state, I decided to go against her wishes as I grabbed her by placing one of my hands against the nape of her neck and the other around her slender legs. I picked her up as if she was as light as a feather.
"Ahh!"
She released a cute little shout, her face turning bright red out of embarrassment.
"Hold on tight."
While saying that, I flew up and headed toward the small city of devotees. I could only hope they would be able to help me… Otherwise, finding her would be practically impossible.
Landing in the middle of the city making quite a bit of noise. I felt a lot of gazes land on me, observing me, wondering what I was doing here.
"I'm not an enemy. I'm trying to find my friend. She told me a while ago to come here if I ever needed her for something. So, here am I. You might know her as Evangeline Ashworth," I practically shouted in the middle of the small city.
Then, sure enough, guards appeared before me.
"You will have to come with us."
I sighed. 'Why is it that whenever I go somewhere, I always get arrested… wouldn't it be easier if they listened to what I had to say?'
"Alright, please make it quick. I don't have all day."

chapters.title: Chapter 186 - 185 - Evangeline Ashworth (2)
chapters.content:
They guided us to the main Temple. It seemed I would have yet another meeting with one of the leaders of a kingdom.
Actually, kingdom might not be the right word for it since the devotees of the God of the Sun aren't in that big of a number. It would be more accurate to call them a small city, or even a village, considering the amount of people present within this place.
Nevertheless, that was only a detail that I occupied my mind with until we entered the main Temple.
"Oh. Looks pretty good," I commented with a smirk as I looked around.
The guard glanced at me with a frown. "Keep walking."
He didn't seem too happy to see me so relaxed when I had been captured. After all, I was now used to those situations, and every single time, I was able to pull it off, even if it would get complicated at times.
Still, I had not lied. It really did look great. There was a human-sized statue right in our faces as soon as we entered. I could only imagine that it represented the appearance of the Sun's God. I wasn't sure how they had managed to get an accurate statue of him, but I did not question it.
The person I was looking for was capable of miracles like this. Otherwise, I wouldn't have come all the way here to find her.
"Are we going to be fine?" Aelua suddenly whispered in my ear.
"Yeah, don't worry. Most leaders love me at first sight," I arrogantly answered.
"I don't know why… but I have a bit of difficulty believing that…"
"What was that? I couldn't hear you."
The guard who was in front snapped his head around, glaring at the two of us with a deadly gaze.
"Stop talking, you two. Otherwise, you will have to face God's punishment."
Now that the guard was saying it. Maybe talking inside the Temple was actually forbidden. Ever since we had entered, we had crossed ways with believers. However, they did either one of two things.
The first one was praying, and the other was simply walking by, acknowledging the guard with a nod of their head. They had never once said anything.
"Is talking not allowed in here?"
"It isn't when an idiot like you is doing the talking," the guard replied, his voice snapping.
Why was everyone calling me an idiot?
Even my own students had called me by that… was I really that much of an idiot in how I acted?
I thought I was just pretty easygoing most of the time. Could that be considered an idiot? After all, I was just following the teachings of my Master. I needed to keep smiling and acting as if everything was fine. That's what he had told me to do.
"Look, it's not that I want to pressure you or anything. But I just want to find my friend. She told me to come here if I wanted to find her. Her name is Evangel-"
"Stop lying through your teeth. There's no way Goddess Evangeline would be affiliated with someone like you," the guard said, cutting me off.
I could only sigh.
I hoped the person in charge would be more welcoming to outsiders. Otherwise, it would make my task here a lot more complicated. Exploring thousands and thousands of kilometers would take way too long. I, at least, needed a little hint of where she had left.
A few more minutes passed, and we were now standing before a tall door, which was at least twice my size. I had already asked what we were waiting for, and the guard told me that it was time for the weekly prayer and that we needed to wait until it was over.
He said that the prayer lasted well over one hour, which was annoying. But I didn't want to make things worse for me. So, I decided to wait patiently.
Aelua seemed worried as she kept looking down and playing with her hands. I found it weird that she was nervous since she was on even grounds with the Elven King. Well, not anymore… but she was before.
It was strange for her to be so intimated by most, especially since her strength wasn't lacking whatsoever. It was actually on a completely different level than practically everyone I knew. She was still a lot weaker than me in terms of fighting abilities. But she compensated by practicing alchemy. She was the best of the best when it came to everything that happened in a lab.
Long story short, she was the most powerful nerd that I had ever met.
Then, finally, after waiting some more, the door finally opened, revealing a scene where a bunch of devotees were praying on their knees. However, that scene only lasted for a second as they all began to stand up.
Honestly, I pitied them.
I didn't understand what was so nice about devoting your entire life to someone else. It seemed extremely stupid to me. However, it wasn't my place to say anything. They could do whatever they wanted with their life. I had devoted mine to eradicating the demons from the world, and they spent theirs praying for a God that might not even exist in the first place.
I was just very pragmatic and logical in that sense. I would never be able to do what they did. It simply wasn't for me.
Anyway, a bunch of them walked out of the room, not even glancing in our direction. They only looked at the guard as they did so.
"Let's go. Time for you to meet our leader. He will be the one who will determine if you are worthy of getting information on Evangeline."
The guard honestly hated Aelua and me. It didn't take a genius to realize that. If it was up to him, he would have kicked us out a while ago. It was a good thing that he wasn't the leader of this place.
Nevertheless, we entered the place where all the devotees would pray every week, and on the stage, there was someone standing upright with his eyes closed and a strong light imbued his body.
He was the leader. He had a certain aura to him. However, it wasn't a cold one like the one Amelia had; it felt warm as if he was ready to accept anyone who would present themselves to him.
Then, as we got closer to him, his eyes opened wide and locked onto me right away.
"Hm… child. You seem extremely conflicted, there is a lot of darkness within you. What is the reason you have come all the way here?" He uttered, the weight of his words felt heavy. It was as if he was able to see through me with a glance.
It was a strange feeling; however, it wasn't yet on the Evangeline level.
"I need to find my friend, Evangeline. I need her help."
The leader didn't seem surprised as I uttered her name.
"Hm… you are telling the truth. But why do you need to find her?"
I frowned slightly. 'Does he also have the skill to determine whether I am telling the truth?'
"I need her help to fight against a demonic creation. Can you help me find her?"
The leader closed his eyes, thinking deeply. A bright light surrounded his body for a moment and then left him.
"Our God would like to talk to you," he suddenly said in a calm voice.
The guard who was beside me staggered forward at those words, his voice shaky. "W-What? He wants to talk with this man?"
The leader nodded slowly.
"B-But the last person who was able to have a personal conversation with him was Evangeline… w-what does this mean?"
"Will he be the one telling where to find Evangeline? I don't want to have a meaningless conversation with him."
The strength in the guard's legs left him as he fell onto his knees. "H-He's not even accepting it right away… j-just who is this man?"
Both the leader and myself ignored him as he continued to talk to himself.
"Yes, he will tell you the information you need to find Evangeline."
"I see. Then, I will meet with him."
Aelua, who was right beside was also in a similar state to the guard as she couldn't believe that a God had asked to meet me so casually, and she found it hard to believe that I was so calm-faced with such a situation as if I had already experienced something similar.
Well, I had met with the God of the ancient tribe. That's why this situation wasn't that strange.
Suddenly, a strong light was imbued into my body in a similar way to the priest earlier. However, this time, it was even stronger, and it did not vanish after a few seconds.
My vision started becoming blurry until I was plunged into a sea of darkness.
When I opened my eyes again, I was in a vast white room with a burning sun above. This environment was a lot different from the one of the previous God. It felt warm.
As I looked around, I saw the God of the Sun staring at me with a curious glance.
"Now that I have got a closer look, It seems you are affiliated with that 'man,'" God's voice echoed throughout the entire space surrounding us. "You should be wary of him. He sees you in a positive light, but if that changes… then your life will change in an instant."
I frowned, having a few different people appear in my mind. "Who are you talking about?"
"The one you call Master. Be careful of him."

chapters.title: Chapter 187 - 186 - Purple Cube (1)
chapters.content:
Be careful of my… master?
I frowned as I stopped walking forward.
I stood there before him for what seemed to be a minute, my skin burning because of how close the sun was. My mind was going in all kinds of directions, trying to understand why a God, out of all people, would make such a comment.
When I regained consciousness of my surroundings, we were no longer in a white, endless room. But instead, on a beach with an umbrella to cover me.
The Sun God was no longer hundreds of meters away from me but right beside me, staring at me with a curious glance, the same one as before.
"Have you finally woken up from your thoughts?"
"My thoughts…? I've only been here for five minutes at most."
"Hm… is that so? You've been in this same position for more than three hours now." He smiled in my direction to comfort me. "I was worried you would burn because of the heat. So, I changed the atmosphere."
"Three hours… I was thinking for more than three hours?" I frowned, trying to remember what had just been going through my mind. But every time I did, nothing would come up. I was just as lost as before.
"Did I say anything?" I suddenly asked God.
"You were murmuring some words, but nothing that would help you remember."
I checked to see if he was telling the truth, and he was.
"Are you the one who did something to my body?"
"Possibly, when I mentioned your master. You seem to have a reaction that was completely different from what I had anticipated; it was as if you were possessed, standing there in the middle of the room."
Hearing those words, I raised one of my eyebrows.
The Sun God had just said that three hours had passed since I had entered his personal environment, no matter how hard I tried. I could not remember what had happened.
There was something strange about him. Something he wasn't telling me.
"Did we talk at all during the past three hours?"
"Somewhat. But it's not conversations you should be aware of at the time being."
That confirmed it.
This was his doing. He was the one who had played a trick on my mind. Who else but a God could have achieved something like this?
"We talked about my master? Is that it? What's so important about him that a God is warning me about it? How do you even know of him in the first place?" I said, taking a step forward toward the Sun God, now within arm's reach. "Tell me right now what we just talked about."
I placed my index against his chest, applying enough pressure on it for the Sun God to start bleeding slightly.
However, when I looked at his expression, he was still smiling with the same curious gaze as before. He was looking down at me as if I was a newborn who he could manipulate in whatever way he wanted.
I hated it.
Being looked down upon.
I despised it so much that I wanted to kill him right now.
But I couldn't. Once again, my strength was lacking.
Maybe that was why he was so scared of my master. Considering his strength, there was a chance he would be able to deal with Gods. Maybe that was why he had warned me about him. He was scared for his own life. There were too many strange things about this situation. I simply could not begin to grasp them.
"I won't tell you what we talked about. But just know that you will remember when the time is right. That is all I will say. Now, I think it's about time we talk about the reason you came all the way to my temple, Evangeline. You want to know where she is, right?"
'I will remember when the time is right…? What kind of bullshit is that.'
Still, I knew that he would not budge, and I could not force him to reveal what we talked about. So, I nodded at his words.
"Alright, tell me where she is then," my tone dry and commanding.
God continued to smile as I ordered him to do something. "You will find her inside the Desert. She is currently looking for a hidden treasure that belonged to me when I was still a human. I was the one who sent her to look for it more than three years ago."
"Oh, the desert?" I nodded repetitively. "Is that so? I'll find her in the Desert. Wow. That's just great. Thanks a lot for the precise indications of where I could find her. Real nice of ya."
I took a deep breath. "Hey, dumbfuck. If I had been looking for such a vague answer, I wouldn't have come to you. Tell me precisely where she is. I can't waste months trying to find her in this endless Desert. Give me a map or something, I don't know."
"Hahaha!" The God suddenly bursted out laughing right in my face. "When you act like this, you really remind me of him."
"Him? Are you talking about my master again? You've met him before?"
The words came out of my mouth on their own. This made no sense. My master should not have been in contact with any Gods. At least, not to my knowledge, so I was it that the Sun God was acting as if he knew him well.
'Should I try to find him once I'm done with finding Evangeline?'
"No. Don't look for him. He'll come see you if he deems it necessary. Not that you would be able to find him in the first place."
My frown deepened as my fists clenched. "You can read my mind? And why are you talking as if you're good friends with my master? This doesn't make any sense. He never met you, for all I know. He never even talked about the Gods. He always said something along the lines of you guys being utterly useless. He despised all of you."
The Sun God did not answer right away, his head turning toward the sun as he let himself bathe under the scorching heat.
However, I did not interrupt him. He seemed to be reminiscing memories, memories from a long time ago.
"Some things happened…" He muttered, followed with a sigh. "But I will tell you this. I know your master a lot better than you, and I'm serious when I say that you should be careful."
He shook his head as he snapped his finger, a strange purple cube appearing in his hands. "Here, with this you will be able to find Evangeline. Just insert some Aether into it, and it will guide you to where she is. However, let me warn you. There is a good chance that she will refuse to help you, especially considering how close she is to finding my remnants."
All sorts of thoughts entered my mind as the God kept talking as I mindlessly held onto the purple cube.
I was trying to make sense of his words. To be more precise, the ones about my master.
Now that I thought about it, I did not know my master's age. I actually did not know much about him. Every time I asked him about his past, he dodged the questions naturally, never making me notice.
He was like me, always hiding his past from those around him, never saying anything. Maybe that was why he had chosen me as his disciple. He had seen himself in me… but for him to know the Sun God, quite well at that. There was a chance that my master was someone from his generation.
"My master. How did you meet him? Did you meet him like you and I are meeting, or were you friends with him?"
I could myself get closer to an answer. I was close to figuring out key information about him.
"Friends? I don't know if he would consider me his friend. Especially after what happe-" The Sun God stopped talking, realizing he was speaking to me. "It was different. Let's just put it at that."
"Anyway, it was a good talk. But it's time for you to leave this place. You have received what you came to get from me."
With that, the Sun God snapped his fingers, and my vision went blurry at the same time. And when I regained it, I was on the ground of the temple, being gawked at like an animal in a zoo.
Aelua, in particular, seemed to be very interested in what had just happened as she was only a few inches from my face, her warm breath brushing against my face.
"Can I get some room to breathe?" I asked with a frown.
However, instead of listening to me, Aelua was looking at something in my arms, reaching out to it.
"What is that?" She said as she pointed at the purple cube.

chapters.title: Chapter 188 - 188: The End
chapters.content:
Hello, you must be wondering why this called The End when the story is nowhere close to being finished. Well, it's quite simple, I have given up on writing this story to its ending. However, I still want to tell everyone what my plans were for its ending.
I'm just as sad as everyone, but I simply can't bring myself to do it. I forgot a lot of things over the past months, and picking this novel up again would be extremely hard for me. It would require me to read a good part of the novel, which is time that I do not have.
I know I have said I would start the updates of this novel again multiple times, but every time, things happened, and as time has gone on, my motivation took a hit, and after some time, I felt like I would never bring myself to write this story again.
So, with that out of the way, let's begin.
The final parts of the story, as most of you would have guessed, were quite simple. Caedrel would have defeated the Demon King in a legendary battle where Caedrel would win by a very close margin, saving the world from its impending destruction and being the hero everyone wanted him to be.
His secret identity would finally be revealed for everyone to know, and he would finally embrace it to its fullest.
His wife would be Amelia, as Ava was revealed to be a traitor working for the Demons. It would be a devastating reveal, one that Caedrel had a lot of difficulties to stomach.
Now, I will go over some of the main mysteries of the book and reveal what they were.
The biggest mystery was the identity of Caedrel's master.
He was supposed to be a Fallen God who had found refuge on Earth, teaching a few select beings. However, he wasn't just any Fallen God; he was supposed to be the greatest fighter the Heavens had ever seen. That's why everyone is deeply scared of him and whether he will come out of his hiding.
Truth be told, my memories about this book are quite hazy, and the plots I had planned are mostly gone from my mind.
Nevertheless, the storyline was supposed to go like this:
Caedrel kills all the children of the Demon King and then heads in his direction.
A lot of things would have happened between the kingdoms, with some betrayals and similar events. However, it's hard to explain at this point.
Also, in the final battle, Caedrel's master would appear and save his disciple from certain death. He would also sacrifice his life so that Caedrel can finally end the Demon King's life once and for all.
If you guys are wondering about some plots and mysteries that I have not covered in this final chapter, please let me know in the comments, and I will reply as soon as I can.
I know that I'm missing a lot in this chapter, but at least you know how the story would have ended, and in my opinion, that's better than leaving this novel unfinished.
I'm sorry that this novel had to end this way, but I know that I will never finish it, as it would require too much time. I would have done it if there had been a chance for me to get back on track and make money again from writing this book. However, since it has been a long time on hiatus, that is not possible.
I'm terribly sorry for not writing the ending of the story like I had wished. But I think that this is better than nothing.
Once again, truly sorry.
Thanks for reading this far, and I hope you will still give the rest of my works a chance.
-Jallen
Here is a preview of the prologue of a story that I will be releasing by the end of February or the start of March.
What would you do if you were reincarnated in your favorite novel?
1. Use your future knowledge to become the strongest in the world.
2. Ensure the plot doesn't diverge so you can predict everything.
3. Steal all the heroines from the main character.
4. Stay as far away from the story as possible to avoid dying.
If you chose the first option, I admire your courage. But me? I'm not suicidal.
The second option? Now that's a smart choice.
If you control the plot, you hold an advantage over every future event. I even considered it at first—until I realized it meant dealing with the main cast. And that? That was a death wish.
The third option? Oh, don't get me wrong; it was tempting.
Legends of Altia had some of the most stunning heroines I'd ever seen—I even remember searching for some of their illustrations online when I was in bed and… well, you know what happened next.
With my future knowledge, I was confident I could steal them all from the protagonist.
But that would mean getting involved with the main cast.
And that was the last thing I wanted.
The plotline of this novel? It was a nightmare.
Every other chapter in the novel, some catastrophic event happened. The main characters almost died at every turn.
And the ending? Everyone from the main cast dies fighting the Demon King. No happy endings, no plot armor.
I'm sorry, but I don't want to die for the "greater good."
It's not like I care about this world.
Hell, I don't even know anyone inside it.
So I made the smartest decision.
I would stay far, far away from anything related to the main plotline of this novel. I was an extra, a nobody, and I intended to keep it that way.
But that plan fell apart the moment I turned eighteen.
In this world, everyone awakens a system at adulthood. Some were common, some rare, some legendary, and a lucky few received unique systems.
Then there was mine.
It was not only unique; it was also of the highest possible rank.
[Life Stealing System]
[Rank: God-Like (Unique)]
[You can steal Life Essence from others to extend your lifespan.]
Overnight, I became the most talked-about person on the continent.
Exactly the opposite of what I wanted.
The very next day, a letter arrived at the orphanage where I stayed.
An invitation.
To Cube Academy—the greatest school in the world.
A place everyone wished to enter.
But not me.
That night, I cried myself to sleep.
That place was hell on Earth. It was where all the main cast would be going.
More than that, this great system of mine? It was actually complete trash.
It literally had a timer telling me when I could die.
[Time remaining before your death: 3 days.]
[Steal Life Essence to extend your lifespan.]
And just like that, in the span of two days, my peaceful, safe life was over.
